Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juliana_svk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Mama Shelter last year, just before Christmas. The hotel was quirky and staff was really nice. About 10- 15 min walk to the nearest metro. Our room was little small but very clean and with super comfy bed. All rooms are painted black, which is super cool but it's little dark and I think because of that I missed my watch when we were leaving. My boyfriend e-amiled them and asked if they found my watch but the answer was NO, so that was little disappointing. We had Kiehl's products in the bathroom with the smell of coriander, really nice touch. As soon as we came back to London I purchased the very same shower gel. Restaurant in the hotel does really nice meals and staff was really friendly and all english speaking. We are both pizza lovers and recommend you trying one of their pizzas. At night, you can visit their bar that serves amazing cocktails. Overall, we enjoyed staying here and would come back besides of losing my watch.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest restaurant/bar in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: LuxeNomadic
Reviews.Content: I am normally a sucker for location but this is 1 place I would sacrifice and put up with a few taxis for. The restaurant is HOT and serves probably the best breakfast I have had in Europe. The dinner only gets better, with great cocktails and amazing food. The deserts are out of this world. The cherry on top are the eye candy staff who actually know how to work as well and are very hospitable. Overall the positives of staying here are -Awsome restaurant -Great staff -clean and minimalist rooms with quirks -apple tv for movies at night The few negatives are -location not that great but manageable -not many good toiletries -No room in the fridges for your own stuff. Overall I love this place and will be back again, the restaurant makes it. Tips for Paris Shops -Merci -L'eclairieur Restaurants -Hotel Costes

Reviews.Title: “Third stay - still liking it !”
Reviews.Author: marumba_11
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in any hotel three times but this was my third visit to Mama Shelter. I really like it . The rooms are very hip but also functional and above all very clean. We always go for the luxe room which is slightly bigger. This hotel is in an up and coming non touristy area but after a days shopping and sightseeing in central Paris - you can go down to the bar or restaurant which is full of the Parisian in crowd and feel that you are in a happening place. Staff are helpful and the demographic that stays here is always trendy. The breakfast is good and the ambience is relaxed. There is a nice atmosphere in this hotel that I havent found in other Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “awesome price to value in paris”
Reviews.Author: omanolo
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at the mama was in Summer 2011 and will go again in summer 2012. In total I have spent already a couple stays there. The Mama Shelter was built I guess in 2008 or so and is kind of a brand new hotel in Paris. It is kind of a budget design hotel. You can have a room for something like 80 EUR per night, which is something like a little miracle in Paris. Normally 80 EUR leads you to a hostel, old crapy place or to the brunch buffet at one of the Grand Hotels in Paris. The look of the hotel is very fresh and perfectly hit my taste. The rooms are a bit cosy but pretty standard suze for Paris. All rooms are equipped with an iMac, which is also the TV or radio station or in room "photo camera" (you can shoot pic's and upload them into the public photo album so evrybody is able to see it). The lamps beside you bed are actually masks of comic hero's like batman etc which you can actually wear. This is one of the popular motives with in the public album - guest with these masks covering their faces... and sometime without cloth :). Only thing that could be improved are the bathrooms, they are missing a bit the freshness and details of the bedroom. The Restaurant and the Bar are the absolute Highlights. They are designed by Philip Starck and are one of the coolest Places in Town. Its hard to descriebe it briefly, you just have to check out the pictures. The whole section is divided into three to four parts. Pizza bistro, restaurant, Bar and further restaurant or in the morning breakfast area. It is very busy nearly every day of the week. A lot french people visit the place which maes it even better as it is not a pure tourist spot. The quality of the food is pretty descent but nothing spectacular, it's a mixture of french and internationl cuisine. So you shouldn't expect a 3 star dish or cosy french dish and you wont be dissapointed. The Service in general is also ok. I have no bad experience nor something exceptionally positive. Locationwise the hotel might seem to be a bitt off the main road which it actually is to a certain extent. Located at the 20est arondissment it is close to the east border of paris (the peripherique) and therefore well connected to the airport CDG. The next Metro is Gambetta and located a 5-10 minute walk. Genrally speaking within 20 minutes you can be in central Paris nonetheless whether you choose to take a cab or the metro. The area itself is not overwhelming but is an emerging spot for you people. You will maybe find a couple nice shops, bars, restaurants etc but not too much. Summarizing the long stroy... 80 for such a Hotel ist really good. Would love to have more places like that in more towns. It's a well done product!

Reviews.Title: “trying to be boutique but forgetting the service...”
Reviews.Author: markandphilippa
Reviews.Content: this is an unusual hotel that I visited whilst on business. It has a great deal going for it, particularly a lively restaurant / bar area that had a great atmosphere. If passing I would definitely call in again for a quick drink and pizza. However there were a number of real lapses in service and attention which mean I wouldn't recommend it (unless you really want to take photos of yourself in your bedroom wearing hotel masks on an iMac computer!!!). The service throughout the hotel was atrocious, only once did I feel that I was the customer and the staff in the hotel were there to serve me, the rest of the time there was a level of ignorance which was shocking - reception abruptness, bar staff ignoring non locals, locking the main entrance and sending you to a 'side' door. However worse than all of this was the housekeeping staff who on my first day I observed them store all the laundry trollies and used room service trays in the fire exit - I did mention this and it wasn't repeated whilst I was there but given the context above around service typifies the attitude of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, friendly and recommended”
Reviews.Author: Galerie167
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Mama Shelter and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is not centrally located but there are a number of Metro Stations within 10 minutes walk that will get you into central Paris quickly. We arrived fairly late on a Friday to find a very lively atmosphere with both the hotel Pizzeria and Restaurant very busy. We managed to eventually get a seat at the 'communal' table in the pizzeria and enjoyed a pleasant if not remarkable pizza. An inquiry at the restaurant in regard to table for the following night was met with a "fully booked", so it may be worth booking ahead of your arrival if you want to eat there at the weekend. We did get a table on the Sunday and enjoyed our meal and found the service from the waiter to be very good. All the staff throughout the hotel, (who were probably recruited on the basis of their looks!) were extremely helpful and couldn't be faulted. We ate breakfast in the hotel 2 mornings (15 euros each) and again found it an enjoyable experience. For a local restaurant recommendation, we found L'Ange Gardien to be an excellent little bistro and only about 5 minutes walk from Mama Shelter

Reviews.Title: “perfect match between cool, cosy and pricefriendly”
Reviews.Author: niels f
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a weekday, so you might expect a more business oriented audience, which was the case @ dinner and @ breakfast. As the website provides plenty of pics there was no surprise, the rooms come as they come, not big (as usual in Paris) but far more practical and original than most hotels in this price range. The bathroom is without any pretention, just functional but misses a bit of 'character'. The Imac in every room has cool features (cityguide, what to do, where to eat, ...), webcam sharing between the rooms (hm hm) and (Free!) video on demand (request a keyboard at the reception if you plan to surf the web). Handy for those without plans to visit the city of Paris. Breakfast was 15 eu and worth it (although all clients were moved to one shared table after 10.30am). Resto and bar area are cosy and well designed. Rooms and bathrooms were tidy. Do know the street is a busy street which involves a bit of traffic noise at morning hours and metro station is a 10 min walk away. would recommend the place if you have been several times to Paris and don't need to be centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Very VERY cooooool !!”
Reviews.Author: cooldudes1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend of 20 Jan for a surprise engagement party and we had a fantastic time. Apple TV in rooms but I don't really go to Paris to watch TV !! Hotel is tres chic with a client base to match, great food, I dare you to finish the moules, and staff who will help in anyway they can to make your stay rock, don't worry if it's slightly away from the centre of things a quick cab ride will soon have you up to your neck in all things Paris. Cannot recommend this place enough. Merci is a great store to visit in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in cool area”
Reviews.Author: chrrul
Reviews.Content: Cool hotel with calm, dark rooms. A good base in the east of Paris. Design is well thought-through from the lifts to the bathrooms. Nice restaurant/bar space. Great breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladymex
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at various hotels in Paris, from the very expensive places for work or the cheap hotels when I was a student - Mama Shelter is in my opinion the best hotel in terms of quality and price - For 89 euros, I managed to get a Luxe room - the room, although a tiny little bit small, was perfect - clean and cosy. The decoration is very original and the staff very friendly. The bar/restaurant is huge (the type of place you would walk into if you happened to walk past) The location of the hotel is great (central and close to the underground, even though not near any touristic attraction as such) and I will definitely come back on my next Parisian trip!

Reviews.Title: “A true surprise”
Reviews.Author: Philippe1963
Reviews.Content: traveling by car, the hotel's location is perfect. Also, there is the garage and the bus which takes you in no time to the Louvre - should you wish to go there. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful (and this is Paris). The room was fairly dark and small bu the perfect wifi and (Kielh's) products in the bathroom mad up of this. After a great day in the city, getting back to the hotel and find the place bustling with happy people was a UNIQUE experience. The huge bar(s) space was filled and part two of the evening was about to begin. PS: The most generous breakfast awaits you in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “again and again and again”
Reviews.Author: ditisdevogel
Reviews.Content: It is a low cost design hotel as I read somewhere. We visited this hotel for the third time and I hope it is not the last time. Restaurant and bar are top, rooms are a bit dark but modern, cosy and functional. One time, there was a bit noise in the corridor from some drunk guests. The internet works, you learn a lot in the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great eclectic place”
Reviews.Author: aliprichard
Reviews.Content: Good service, good deals, really fun place to stay with very helpful staff. You have to enter in to the spirit of the place. Not polished 5 star service but very good for the price. Mini bar a ripoff but what's new? Good breakfast was included in our deal. I'll be going back when I can.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: letsgo053
Reviews.Content: A hip hotel , near père la chaise cemetry, comfortable bed, free internet, a Mac in your room, nice restaurant (book in advance!), lots to read in the elevator and on the ceilings!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky”
Reviews.Author: Hend14
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend surprised for my birthday. She managed to get two nights for £160 a summer special. That made this a very competive rate for Paris in a trendy hotel. The hotel had apple tv in the room with free movies. The bar was cool and nice and lively at night. Good position of the hotel which allows you to walk around a cheaper part of Paris

Reviews.Title: “Aesthetics over function”
Reviews.Author: nilesp
Reviews.Content: We accepted a offer for a discount price making the room ca € 75/night, and at this price we were actually quite pleased with the room although a few niggles remained. The room was interestingly decorated/designed but was quite dark as there were no ceiling lights, and the bedframe looked good but you couldn't sit up in bed since it didn't seem to support your weight. There was a water boiler but no tea. Another (albeit minor) thing which affected our impression was that a decorative flower in the bathroom was cleary dead and slightly rotten. On the plus side every room has a 24 inch iMac with several movies pre-loaded, the shower had Kiehls products, and we were given a map of the area with a lot of recommendations of places to eat, shop and visit marked. As we only stayed two nights we didnät have time to visit the hotel restaurant/bar but it seemed really vibrant and nice with quite a few people on both Monday and Tuesday night. Lastly the staff were really nice and helpful. Thus, to summarize, while quite ok at the discount price, we probably wouldn't have been very happy paying full price.

Reviews.Title: “Young hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jujuetmarc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and always had a pleasant stay there. The interior design is very creative and trendy, without being over the top "design". Rooms are equipped with an iMac tv with plenty of good movies free of charge. The restaurant, the pizzeria and the bar are very good and reasonably priced. Located on the 20th arrondissement (away from all the tourists!!!), there are three subway stations around the hotel and it's only about 10 minutes away from gare de Lyon and not much further from gare du Nord, which is very convenient for those coming by train from anywhere in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and cool”
Reviews.Author: BrianOjai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The location is out of the main tourist areas yet it's easy to get around using the bus or walking to one of the nearby Metro stations. The hotel interior is very cool and stylish, but comfortable. The rooms are bigger than your average Parisian hotel room with good beds, Macs as TV, good wifi. There is also a laundry room available which is much more convenient than dragging your laundry around with you. I had breakfast there several mornings. It's pretty good though the coffee was hit or miss. Dinner was good and original. You should try and book a table ahead of time if you can, otherwise there is usually free space at the counter. All in all, one of my favorite hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Très chic”
Reviews.Author: JohnWean
Reviews.Content: You can't help but bask in the 'cool' factor of this hotel. The design is great - all concrete walls and Taschen table books lying around on antique furniture with the occasional transparent lampshade thrown in for contemporary measure. The welcome at reception was really charming, the rooms are a comfortable size, the bathrooms are stocked with Kiehl's products, the pizzeria is fantastic and the cocktail menus contains a White Pepper and Basil Caipirinha amongst other tempting offerings. I would like to have given this 3.5 out of 5, though, as the lack of power points in-room and the disappointment when I couldn't make myself a cup of tea after a day of travelling was a little bit of a hiccup but I'll definitely be treating this as my regular in-and-out Paris trip hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: Marta R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fabulous, the location could be better but nothing is perfect. We stayed 4 nights and the rooms and service was flawless. The bed is the best thing after touring Paris for an entire day! The restaurant needs to be booked in advance, the food is delicious and the atmosphere is great. The pizzeria is also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly friendly and welcoming staff. Not sure about the constant gloom.”
Reviews.Author: EdwardE8
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel having read good reviews and it was convenient for a work commitment on our first night. It is a bit of a trek in to central locations and certainly for anything on the west of Paris, however as long as you are aware of that in advance it's not a problem, and it is an 8 minute walk to the nearest tube, Alexandre Dumas, which is 5 stops, but with 1 change, to Bastille. It is well priced for a boutique hotel in Paris, and we found the staff incredibly welcoming, professional and friendly. The facilities are also excellent in terms of great power shower, good quality hair dyer, iMacs in room, upmarket toiletries. However I found the constant low level lighting EVERYWHERE in the hotel, which resulted in a permanent sense of gloom, grating and claustrophobic. It is a design feature, but it feels overly stylised, especially when it is not just in the bar but in your hotel room. For breakfast we went out on to the outside terrace as wasn't pleasant to eat breakfast in a nightclub style environment and was a struggle to find buffet items, crockery and tea bags in the darkness! So great service and price for the quality, but I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “ok place, poor service, decent drinks”
Reviews.Author: Andrea L
Reviews.Content: service is not the best in this place, no cocktails are served until 7pm and there is no table service at the bar... drinks are not bad, prices are not very high (10-14 euros per drink) but... frankly it's the worst philip starck designed bar ive visited so far

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris hotel - super cool and not too pricey”
Reviews.Author: Claireg800
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel.Its a bit out of the way in East Paris but is super cool. Very boutique.Brilliant bar which is heaving at night. Rooms are great. Design of hotel is great. Massive iMac's in every room. Breakfast was fantatsic. All in all a great hotel that I would def stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Mama Love”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Paris and this is my favourite. Generally I am here for work and although you have a short walk to the hotel I quite enjoy this. The area is safe at night and you walk along busy roads. Also if you have time there is the famous cemetery nearby Pere Lachaise, go look up Jim Morrison or Oscar Wilde. Myself I love the hotel decor and as I am working I love the fact that when I get back to the hotel at night and I want to have a bit of fun I can just go downstairs to the bar/restaurant. Some nights it turns into a club with dj and of course you don't have the hassle of trying to find a cab to get home, just stagger upstairs ! And great cocktails too. For what you get the hotel is very reasonable, ( book well in advance for best prices ) stylish decor, apple TV with free films and Kiehls shampoo and coriander body wash, what more could a girl want. Oh and a black arum lily in your phillipe starck bathroom ! and if you get bored you could always read the carpet. My only complaint was I needed to do a bit of work in the room one night and the lighting was a problem. The option of an overhead light would have been most welcome. Also final piece of advice, open the curtains in the morning to check for your black underwear on the black carpet, I nearly left mine there !

Reviews.Title: “Mama does indeed know best”
Reviews.Author: UpFlatDown
Reviews.Content: OUI! The decor, styling, uber-smiley and ultra-professional staff, fantastic food, tasty (and strong!) cocktails, internet access in every room, cleanliness, location, size, the enormous plush double bed, the power shower - even the complimentary olive oil shower gel was way better than anything else you'd find. I find it very hard to agree with previous reviews about the inherent problems of it not being near a metro stop - come on people, there's nothing wrong with walking now and again; work off some of that privileged living and enjoy the sights and sounds of Bagnolet while you stroll! Yes, the hotel is dark - but that's the whole point. Too many hotels are clinically lit, with all the ambience of an operating theatre. Not Mama though - beautiful surroundings in every way. If you don't like avant-garde interior design which stimulates the senses and challenges what you think you know, stay somewhere else. On the other hand, if you're looking for something truly unique, book in with Mama and drink it in.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: MartinCanberra
Reviews.Content: This was an interesting hotel, with good and bad. The obvious difficulty if you are planning to go sight seeing is the location. It is at least a 15 minute walk from the metro - even unencumbered by luggage and assuming you head off in the right direction. Coming from the Alexandre Dumas metro is easily enough navigated - you come up onto Rue de Bagnolet. From Gambetta can be trickier unless you are familiar with the area because you come up into a square with roads going everywhere... The youthful exuberance of the staff is great and they do try to make you feel welcome. My room was not ready when I arrived a little early, but it did become a nuisance when it was still not ready 45 minutes after check in time. I wanted to get out and about so left my bags. As others have said the rooms are dark. I didn't mind, but with the lighting there is it was annoying to have to ind individual switches to turn them off! I found the room spacious enough and the showers and facilities were excellent. The entertainment set up is great with free extras - including free recent release movies (note:including some naughty ones). The restaurant was excellent for dinner...it is a popular place and the crowd were all enjoying themselves thoroughly. Mama serves a great breakfast, the largest selection I've seen in a hotel in this price range, and again, the enthusiasm of the staff is noteworthy. Overall I enjoyed my stay. I probably will not return but will find somewhere closer to a metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “a feast in the east”
Reviews.Author: Design-Family
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of this hotel, in the 20th arrondisement of Paris (east). I have stayed at this establishment three times while working, and once with my wife for her birthday. This hotel is run spectacularly. Amel, Bruno, Sabine, and the rest of the team are incredibly professional, friendly, and on top of things. The staff go out of their way to make everyone feel comfortable, welcome, and at home ... despite being a large hotel, it is serene and quiet in the rooms (affording a great opportunity to work if needed). My wife commented on this last trip how she felt that everyone working at the hotel was young and vibrant, while still being very courteous and professional - I totally agree. Guests feel relaxed and at ease. The rooms continue to be fantastic - small, clean, great internet/tv/movies, a large and bright bathroom with nice products. There is a laundry if needed, taxis can be called at a moment's notice, and for those of us who love to ride, there is a Velib station directly across from the hotel. Although lacking a gym, there is a Club Med Gym two blocks away where one can purchase a day pass. One of the other fantastic benefits of this hotel is the restaurant and bar. A delicious and fresh menu prevails, with a great wine and beverage selection. When working I customarily sit at the bar and have a quick, late dinner - the service is always attentive and fun and SUPER quick if need be - while the food is always delicious and beautifully presented. We salute the Mama team for all that they do - I always feel like a special guest at this hotel, which feels distinctly 'un-Parisian', yet offers the very best that Paris can be! Bravo - Harley

Reviews.Title: “What a cool place!”
Reviews.Author: goodmorningirl
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk in, this place is in one word, cool. I found the size of the room to be pretty nice and the styling was so different but also calming. The black walls were very calming and gave the room an urban vibe. The bathroom was a good size. Everything was clean and the design was modern. The elevators had cool facts to read as you went up to your floor. The hotel is a bit out of the way of the things to do in Paris but it is only a 10-15 minute walk to the Metro which was good. I would absolutely stay here again for the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “good price value - have have to like the difference and we did”
Reviews.Author: samiweiss
Reviews.Content: yes, it is dark and yes, the rooms are small but it's a perfect spot for open minded people who like it little different. the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quiet and clean and at a good price for Paris. We have not been to the restaurant but we really enjoyed the pizzeria. pretty good for not italian! there is a bus station right in front of the hotel so you can leave the car in the hotel garage and hop on the bus that brings you straight to Louvre via hotel de ville. What more you want for a sightseeing trip? if I got it right from the Paris people I know the concept of the hotel is: building a stylish place in an arrondissement which is still affordable. So it is the 20th. But you have everything around like bars, brasseries and stores if you need anything around. our kids liked it as well. Philippe Starck is fun for kids and extras like the mac with TV, radio, heaps of DVDs & internet makes a trip round. We can recommend. We really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, sophisticated but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: luvtapas
Reviews.Content: It's what you expect from the website photos. Super stylish, sophisticated and very parisian. HOWEVER, it isnt near a metro station so be prepared to cab it or take a bus to the metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but very strange”
Reviews.Author: RockDiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late August during a business trip. The rooms are small (no surprise in Paris) and were very dark ; the walls are painted black, lights are few and dim. I turned on every light in the room and still found it kind of eerily dark, even with the curtains open on a sunny day. Lobby and restaurant walls also painted black - and there was chalk "graffiti" on the ceilings in the public spaces. If they were going for "atmosphere", they achieved it - but it's not my kind of atmosphere! On the plus side, everything was very clean and modern, and the bed was very comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. . If you want to have dinner at the restaurant, make a reservation! The place was packed every night with locals. Restaurant food was good, and we enjoyed the pizza parlor, however service was a bit slow. There is no room service and no gym. I would not recommend this hotel for business travelers - it is too far away from the convention center and from central Paris. Location is also not the greatest for vacationers - the neighborhood is not the greatest and again, too far from central Paris. There is a bus that stops right outside the hotel and runs right down to the Louvre/Hotel de Ville area, and a Metro line a few blocks away. Cimitiere Pere Lachaise is just a few blocks away as well - go visit all the famous dead people, including Jim Morrison :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it, would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: NatureBunny
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Mama Shelter after a red-eye flight, I was relieved to see that it was modernly decorated with decent sized rooms. With so many small, dingy hotel rooms at this price range in Paris, I thought we had really lucked out. My weary brain slowly started to pick up on all the weird features (plastic batman mask for a lamp?! no door on the shower?). Without the luxury of a comfortable bed to compensate for all the quirks, these features quickly went from fun and endearing to tacky. I could have easily looked past the decor if the food in the restaurant hadn't been so awful and the hallway hadn't stunk of rotten garbage. The front desk staff was very professional and friendly though! Not nice enough, however, to get us to ever return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Once again a very nice stay in Mama Shelter”
Reviews.Author: Tjolmen
Reviews.Content: It's the 6th or 7th time we stay in Mama Shelter and have never been disappointed. The hotel is located at the back of the Cimetiere du Pere Lachaise, a 15 minute walk from the nearest metro stop. Not the best location, but it's not a bad neighbourhood and if you don't mind a bit of walking it's just fine. When you arrive staff welcomes you with a smile, and are very helpfull. Also when you have requests in advance, they have always managed to fullfil them (e.g. rooms at the calm side of the building) The rooms are not that big but have all the things you need. A good bed with descent cushions and soft clean linnen. An IMac on the wall provides you with free internet, a nice selection free movies, tv, different radio chains and a photoboot to send a souvenir to your email address. In the small bathroom you have a comfortable rainshower and Kiehls products (the hairdryer looks great, but it doesn't dry your hair that well ) The rooms are also well isolated, so you don't hear your neighbours (they don't block the sound of DJ-sets in the bar on saturdays ...so take that in account if you have a room on the first floor) The design of the hotel is something you love or hate...I love it. Black carpet with text on it, black walls, concrete ceilings and masks as bedlamps. If you like bright light rooms, this is probably not your thing. The best thing of it all is that when you book early you can have all this for very reasonable prices. I didn't try the breakfast, as you have many great breakfast opportunities in Paris. Are there negative points...well, prices in the bar are quite high, so is a parking space. You can have some noise when you have a room at the 1st floor in the weekend. I already booked my next stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but unconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: Schroedinger
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is great, and a bargain compared to most Parisian hotels. The rooms are small, but clean, tidy, and well organized. Bonus point for a fancy Apple TV, with free movies. The breakfast buffet was amazing. In the evening, there's a stylish bar with great drinks. Service was also very good. The only negative thing is the location, which quite frankly is lousy. It's far from the metro (10-15 min walk), and the taxi ride to the city centre takes at least 20 min. So it all depends on what you're up to in Paris. If you'll spend your day at the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, Musee d'Orsay etc, I'd opt for something closer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “"Simply the best"”
Reviews.Author: joooooles
Reviews.Content: Warm, friendly staff. Beautiful rooms with a great entertainment feature and quite possibly the best shower I've ever had. The whole hotel bears a delicate vanilla scent that makes you cling to the service as you're checking out yelling "no, i'm not going". It was pure bliss. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “unique and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: innaMontreal
Reviews.Content: I had seen photos but was surprised still by how original and appealing Mama Shelter is. We stayed six days in July 2011. Booked and prepaid well in advance, securing the low 89 € rate and thought it excellent value. Decor is modern and cosy, with great attention to detail and not in the least bit austere. Graffiti, many original lights, good bed with fluffy comforter and a bright mini kitchen space - with microwave, sink and electric kettle, and rooms have AC, free Wi-Fi, a safe... Tea, coffee, food are not included so get your own :) Cups and cutlery too, as there are just two glasses in kitchen. Shower is roomy, large enough for two, and with both a rain shower head and a sleek hand-held shower. There is a good/real hairdryer and Kiehl's shampoo and liquid soap only (so bring a shower cap if you need it). The area is pleasant and transportation not a problem - to metro it's a longish/about 15 min. walk to Alexandre Dumas station or a short ride (few stops) on 26 bus to Nation, plus there are other good buses close by. But this isn't the place to stay if you want to walk out to popular sights. Hotel's restaurant was quite busy but they keep some places for hotel guests, but do reserve upon arrival or the day/morning before going. We found the food quite good and very fresh, and the place was buzzing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClaireJessica
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous one-night stay at Mama Shelter in late May. Having been to Paris quite a few times before, I decided to try a different area of the city this time and I wasn’t disappointed. It is definitely quite a way from the city centre, but there is a bus stops right outside the door that takes you straight into town (via the Marais, which was perfect for me as I planned to shop up a storm!) and the Pere-Lachaise cemetery is right around the corner. As I was flying home to Australia early the next morning, I decided to get an early night and eat in the hotel’s Pizzeria for dinner. The food was fantastic – I highly recommend it! The room was stylishly furnished and also very spacious for a single – and the shower was fabulous. If you’re not a fan of black walls though, I would steer clear! There was an iMac in the room with free movies on demand and the toiletries provided were Kiehl’s which was a nice surprise. Another (slightly quirky) thing I loved were the random facts printed on the wall of the lift – they made every journey up to my room very entertaining! The staff were lovely and very helpful – I arrived a little before check-in time and they stored all my bags away with no problems at all. It was also great value for money, especially for Paris. I highly recommend Mama Shelter!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and radical design”
Reviews.Author: rro2005MAD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in this hotel in late July 2011. We loved it at first sight: beautiful black carpets, small and minimalist room painted in black, grey and white, an iMac in every room with free movies on demand (including adult movies), free wifi... The bed was extremely comfortable and our room gave to a pedestrian street (we faced a library), so it was very quiet. Very soft and thick towels in the bathroom, Kielhs shampoo and shower gel...no complaints here. The only drawback: it's a 15m walk to the nearest metro station, although there is a bus stop almost at the door, and a vélib point (Paris bike rental scheme) also in front. Otherwise, the front desk staff will be happy to call a cab for you, which usually arrive in seconds rather than minutes thanks to a web-based reservation system. Overall, a very good experience in an unusually designed hotel with friendly and capable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with style”
Reviews.Author: Pieeter
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Mama Deluxe room" through the internet for a price that is hard to beat in Paris. We loved our stay! The hotel is near the périférique, what means that it is easily accessible from the highway. We parked our car in the parking underneath the hotel and were welcomed by an extremely friendly and helping staff. The rooms were great, they are not extremely big, but have all needed, designed greatly. On top there are some funny quirks like the photobook filled with pictures hotel guests took with the iMac present in the room, and the masks covering the bed lamps. Badroom was nice and clean, very good shower included. The hotel is situated next to a deserted train rail, what makes it pretty quited, and the terrace on that side is great to sit on. Both for having the breakfast (nice and complete, not included in the room price) or having a drink at night. Only minus is that it's quite a walk to the nearest metro station, but we used the vélib bikes (right across the street) a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Very unique and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RBC229
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and VERY quiet, with much more modern rooms than many hotels in this price range. The restaurant and bar were also unique...even the elevators have a sense of style! The rooms are a little dark, with limited lighting, but overall this was not a problem. This was a nice stay and we frankly wish we could have stayed our entire stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, interesting, satisfying - Mama loves you!”
Reviews.Author: RowanBenecke
Reviews.Content: This hotel makes Paris look good. If you're tired of the typically small, old, horribly overpriced, always forgettable European hotels, then this one is for you. As boutique design hotels go, Mama Shelter falls into the range of similar sleek and minimalistic furnishings, smaller rooms and mood lighting. But unlike the usual W-esque and Philippe Stark-like properties, this hotel is affordable, treats you well with great service, happy people and very comfortable rooms. The post modern art motif, crazy chalk writings on the ceilings, rubber duckies in the bathrooms, and super hero face masks as bedside lamp shades only add to its overall charm. But the very hip and oh so tres chic restaurant and bar area is very much what makes staying at this hotel even more fun. The menu is interesting (if somewhat limited), the wine list is adequate, but the cocktails are unique and the mixologists know their stuff. No wonder this is often a celebrity hang-out. And the club across the street usually has great live music bands.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: arch_82
Reviews.Content: this hotel, although a little far out from the centre, was amazing. the rooms were cozy and we had one of the best nights sleep. staff were amazing, helpful and accommodating. I had to stay an extra night, and they managed to find me another room despite originally being told it was fully booked. food was great. beds perfect. one amazing shower! the one minor downside is that the bar/restaurant is a trendy hangout at the moment. it was very busy, lots of people around the lobby so hard to get to lift. however, no sound traveled and we were not disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Cool hotel , bad location”
Reviews.Author: GuiMC
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Mama Shelter for 2 nights in july and LOVED it! If you´re looking for a cool and trendy place, it´s your right choice! Friendly staff, nice nice nice rooms, modern bathroom with Kiehl´s products (wow!), very cool bar/restaurant (crowded with parisians every night), great wi-fi connection in room... The only bad thing is the location, a bit far from the touristic attractions,altough a few blocks from the metro station (Alexandre Dumas or Gambetta stations). If it´s your first time in Paris and you like to walk, I guess it´s better to stay in other neighborhood, like St Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arb9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2010 for our 1st wedding anniversary and a short break to Paris. The hotel is very modern and very arty! Loved the difference of this hotel and the ambience created. It's slightly dark and I adored the lighting. It's easy to find, 15 mins walk from the station. Rooms are small but clean. Rooms have Mac TV's with free internet access which is great for those last minute searches you may want to do in Paris. Good value for money including breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guideposts
Reviews.Content: Mama Shelter is a gem of a find, great stylish quirky hotel with a trendy vibe, relax over great dinner and delicious French wines

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BrunaRego
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels ever!  Me and my boyfriend stayed there for 4 nights and we loved every second of it! The staff is really nice and helpful, and the room was awesome: black, beautiful, with great touches like the cool lamps with masks (and other lightning, many options), the floor carpet, which I loved, the Mac tv, great, easy to use - with loads of great -and free!- movies, and the bed - ooohhh amazing! So confortable!!! The bathroom is really clean, all white, with great shower and khiels amenities - thumbs up! Is not far from subway stations, which is great, and there are many shops, bars, markets near. We went to the restaurant one night - great space, great food, a little pricey, but worth it! The pizza is awesome too, and you can take it to your room. We ate breakfast there only at our last day. Is a bit expensive, but it's so sooo good - breads, croissants, hot foods, pastry, jams, so many things- and all great. Was my first time in Paris, I loved the city - and Mama Shelter contributed a lot for that too! Recommend for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Edgy but nice!!”
Reviews.Author: babyili
Reviews.Content: Being my usual self , had it not been so reasonably priced I would never have picked a hotel so far from the center or so peculiar. However I loved the edge and ambience of this hotel. It does not have luxurious rooms but everything was sparkling clean and although basic in every department it does not fail you in anything. Most of all you are going to love the price, which if you intend to stay many days in paris is very important, and for that price this is as good as it gets and the young crowds that fill the hotel lobby every night! Don't miss the hotel restaurant wich becomes a hip bar afterhours!!! Dont forget to order Confit de Canard and apple crumble!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BRUNCH RIP-OFF WARNING!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wolfus
Reviews.Content: Beware, beware!!! The hotel offers a very nice atmosphere and choice of food for brunch but no-where do they tell you what it will cost you!!!! Outside at the entrance they advertise a 20 Euro breakfast. We went in, selected a few things from the brunch, were offered a lovely fresh drink, selected a few small items on a small plate and when we received the bill, found we had been charged 38 Euros each! - not even a glass of cheap Champagne was offered to justify the price. Not a surprise now that the one hotel partner/owner was enjoying a bottle of champagne on his table - the place was packed and he was due to earn more from his brunch charges than from the rooms!!! I hope that you go there, try it and leave without paying :)) Revenge needed!!

Reviews.Title: “Come to Mama”
Reviews.Author: LaMarianina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the recommendation of friends in the design/media sector. The hotel did not dissapoint. The rooms are sleek and comfortable and bound to inspire anyone with an interest in interiors/designs. The service was very good with efficient check in and helpful staff. There was good attention to detail including complimentary Kiehls tolietries and free in-room wifi. We didn't eat the restaurant but the breakfast was superb. The location wasn't in the centre but it was easy to get to on the metro. I would definitely return- my only regret was that we didn't sample the fare at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Mama Loves you & We love Mama”
Reviews.Author: victorar
Reviews.Content: We arrive at Mama Shelter from London after a long day of work and traveling, David on reception was great, very friendly & profesional ... we loved the room, good size, very confortable bed, loved the lighting(lots options), the MAC Tv super super cool and easy to use, shower is nice and water preasure is good too, we went for dinner at the Pizzeria in the hotel ... those pizzas are VERY GOOD. Atmosphere in the bar/restauramt was great too! For us everything was great while at Mama ... I will recomend this Hotel to everyone ... Mama loves you & We Love Mama :-)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. Cheap does NOT equal good value.”
Reviews.Author: tpaladino77
Reviews.Content: Oh boy, where to start. I travel to Paris frequently for work; in fact, at one point I was traveling there several times a month. I usually stay at the Westin Paris (as a Starwood platinum member), however my company wanted me to find a less expensive option, so I looked into Mama Shelter. I had heard about it through a design magazine, and saw that it was a Philippe Starck hotel, which appealed to me -- my apartment in NY is Philippe Starck designed, so I'm obviously a fan of his work. The place looked like it was modern and well appointed, especially with Starck's trademark whimsy, so I figured it would be worth a shot, especially considering the low prices. What a mistake. I arrived on a late flight (around 11pm local time) and was pleased at first when I arrived; there was a bit of a crowd at the downstairs bar and it seemed like a nice enough place. I checked myself in, and went up to my room... that's where it all went downhill. The first thing I noticed was that there was NO OVERHEAD LIGHTING in the room at all, or any other kind of substantial lamp. The only available light was from the small desk lamp, the computer, and the two stupid superhero-mask lamps on either side of the bed (none of which provided anywhere near enough light to see anything in the room). So I'm stumbling around this pitch-black room with my suitcases after getting off of a five-hour flight and 30 minute cab ride, with no way to even see well enough to begin to unpack. Awesome. Next thing I notice is that there is NO MINIBAR OR ROOM SERVICE. So it's now midnight and I'm starving and pretty much screwed, as the only way I'm going to eat will be to trek out into the Paris streets and find a cafe, when all I really want is to have a quick bite and go to sleep. Onward, I then realize that there is also NO TELEVISION. Yes, there is an iMac computer, which they have set up as sort of an all-in-one entertainment solution. It's not. It's indecipherable, particularly in the pitch black of your room, and the screen is also tiny and nowhere near loud enough to be of any real use. Most people these days travel with their laptops, but nobody I know travels with a television. While it's apparently a cool thing to write on your website that every room has an iMac computer, it's pretty much useless in a practical sense. And finally, when I booked my room, the hotel was offering a promotion which included a free bottle of champagne at check in, which I opted for. Except what they provided was NOT REAL CHAMPAGNE. In Paris. France. I didn't even know that was possible. Needless to say that I was completely livid. I spent about an hour in my room before leaving in absolute disgust at around 1am. I went down to the front desk, cancelled my five-day reservation and took a taxi over to the Westin, where I could at least get a steak (and not need a flashlight to see it), then watch a movie before bed on an actual television. Yes, it was quadruple the price, but worth every single Euro at that point. They advertise this hotel as a cool boutique experience, but it is not. It is an economy hotel with some design sensibility thrown in. If your choice is between this and a youth hostel, then I guess it's a better choice. But beyond that, for the money, you'd do better at a Hampton Inn. It's a shame too, because it does have potential. With some track lighting (or at least a powerful floor lamp), a minibar and a real television, they may actually have something worthwhile. But as it stood when I was there, it was a disaster. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but some niggles make it less than perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Steve1982uk
Reviews.Content: We liked this place - cool, chic, modern etc., which is certainly a bit different. The hotel is not in the town centre but is only 10 mins walk to the metro and so only 20 mins into the town centre. The service on the desk was excellent. The rooms were comfortable, with Apple TV, Kiehl's shower gel in the bathroom and which innovative lighting. The bar and restaurant downstairs were great - plenty to muse over! However there were a few niggly things about this place: it was too dark, there was a kettle but no cups or coffee, there was no hand-soap, and there were lots of randomly placed light switches... The service in the restaurant downstairs was exceptionally disappointing, which kind of ruined the experience for us. I would recommend this place, just.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: coomankevin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to view the arrival of the tour de France. The rooms are full of P. Starck design elements and the Apple computer/TV with free internet acces is a great feature. The restaurant is trendy/chique and is an adequate and nice alternative when you don(t want go back into town to get food after a day of shopping. Only downside is the location: you need to walk 15 min to get to the nearest subway station witch is not on a main subwayline (you'll need to change to get to the centre)...

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are design savvy & want to get to know Paris like a local”
Reviews.Author: nessie420
Reviews.Content: Our room was basic but fully equipped with a stylish interior design. I really liked the fact that there was free wifi and an iMac in our room providing entertainment and useful stuff such as direct access to google maps, which helps you plan and research things in town. Right across the street there s a decent concert venue and three different bus lines run right in front of the door. Metro is only a couple of minutes walk. Furthermore the Bastille district and rue Charonne are down the road (walking distance). This is a brilliant part of town with loads of shops, bars, cafés and nightlife – really popular among locals. To be aware of: Apparently a really nice rooftop balcony belongs to the hotel. Unfortunately it was closed when we were there (april / eastern weekend). Mouse and keyboard for the iMac are provided in return of a deposit (100euro at the time). There is a minibar/fridge that's more like a vending machine – you can't put your own shopping in there. As stated in other reviews the room is not super spacious and the hotel is not right next to any major sight (unless J. Morrison's grave counts as one). Furthermore in our booking breakfast wasn't included and would have cost 15 Euro. Anyhow. These were all things that couldn't bother us and wouldn't matter to the overall experience but they might do to others (as stated in other reviews). If you want to get to know the "real" and not only postcard Paris , this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Different and cool but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: chris300hills
Reviews.Content: We loved Mama Shelter but like some other reviewers were slightly bemused by certain "features". Rooms are definitely on the smaller side and there is a distinct lack of hanging or other storage space but as we were only there for two nights it wasn't a major issue. As other people have said, the provision of a microwave and kitchette sink seem completely surplus without any tea/coffee supplies, cups etc and the fact that you can't store anything in the minibar/fridge is annoying. Also why no handsoap? The subdued lighting is obviously all about mood but again it is a bit frustrating that you can't read a book if you want to. Definitely a case of form over function but what form. There is a lovely atmosphere to the place: the staff were all wonderful and couldn't do enough to help and the bar/restaurant area is very cool. So cool that I quickly realised I was probably the oldest person in the place. We quite liked that the hotel is a bit out of the way. There is a bus stop right outside with frequent services to the city centre and just round the corner there is a direct bus to gare du nord. There is also an excellent boulangerie 50 metres down the street which is open to 20:00 most nights. As someone else has already said "All in all great hotel that would have been perfect with a few small extra details in the rooms" but it does have that fantastic smell.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - make sure you visit the pizzeria”
Reviews.Author: emtickner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mama Shelter for 3 nights and we thought it was great. It's a really stylish hotel with friendly, helpful staff, and a great reasonably priced pizzeria and bar downstairs. We heard the restaurant was great too but it's so busy you have to book so we didn't bother (having the whole of Paris to choose from!). The hotel is quite out of the way from the tourist centre of Paris, but I liked that. It was nice to get away at the end of a busy day. Even though it's not at the centre it's so easy to get to. It's about 10mins on the metro, then a 5 minute walk. It also means you have much more reasonably priced bakeries and supermarkets around. The rooms are very comfortable but I thought they were the only part of the hotel that let it down slightly. They are very dark - black walls and carpet - with no overhead lighting, which makes it very great for sleeping but not so good when you want to get dressed in the morning (we lost a few pairs of black socks!!). You also don't get a lot of toiletries in the bathroom, just small Kiehl's shower gel and shampoo - no handwash etc. We're used to packing very light so we normally rely on the hotel providing these. You can buy them in reception but they're very expensive. There is a small kitchen area with tea and coffee making facilities and a microwave, but no cups (we were drinking hot drinks out of water glasses) and there is a fridge, but you can't keep your own food in it, which defeats the purpose of the microwave. But, there were great bits in the room like the free to use iMac with loads of free films and wifi, and the really comfortable huge bed. All in all great hotel that would have been perfect with a few small extra details in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Really quirky. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: NomNomNomBrighton
Reviews.Content: After some initial issues with the room - they showed me three before I was happy - the experience was great fun. The hotel is quite out of the way. The nearest Metro is a 5-10 minute walk away but once you've mastered this its pretty easy to get around. The hotel is very hip. Great (and packed bar). Fantastic smell throughout. The pizzerria is worth a visit - its open till 1am. Two pizzas, a beer and a glass of wine cost £30. The first rooms were tiny and slightly depressing, they also could do with a good spring clean (although the room itself was far from dirty). When I complained the manageress personally saw to it that we got better room that she hasd personally checked before hand. She was really helpful and friendly and turned a bad situation into a more than good one. The staff are great for suggesting places to go - even recommending vintage stores. The only criticisms I have - you only get one shampoo and one shower gel. No hand soap. We had to buy are own at the supermarket. Considering the price of the rooms and the type of hotel (and that they advertise their rooms as having Khiels toilletries as a selling point of the room) it was dissapointing. The only other thing is the baffling kitchenette area - you get a mini bar not a fridge (you cant take anything out of it without paying and you cannot put your own things in it) and you get a microwave and kettle. There are no tea/coffee making equipment (spoons/mugs/tea) so again, we had to buy our own. It just seemed odd to have a microwave full-stop. I would definitely stay here again. A word to other travellers - it is worth paying the extra for a bigger room. The basic rooms were tiny, exacerbated by the black walls.!

Reviews.Title: “A bit on the expensive side”
Reviews.Author: Nikkers123
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a unique experience in Paris and you don't have tonnes of cash to spend, this is a good hotel. It was quite expensive at 150euros being a bit out of the way. We bought a metropass and it was easy enough to get around, though. I forgot my shower cap and asked for one at the front desk - it was 12 euros to buy. Yes, there were nice Kiels products but no handsoap, for instance, and one of the lights in the bathroom was out. If you're looking for a hip hotel that puts design ahead of all else, this hotel was a cool place to be. Loved the ambience, could have done with more basic hotel-y stuff like free toiletries (within reason), which I'd expect from a 150 euro a night hotel. That being said, it was the nicest place I've ever stayed in Paris. The free wifi and internet on big macs in the lobby was an asset.

Reviews.Title: “Blown away by the room size and friendly customer service”
Reviews.Author: ckoolmike
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night on a weekend getaway to Paris from London. I stayed there on Saturday Feb 12. After an exhausting day walking around the city, I wanted to curl up in my bed and sleep. When i first entered Mama Shelter, i was immediately greeted by the warm check-in staff and the decor. What a chic and posh lobby!! :) The check-in staff was really attentive by giving me a quick overview of Mama Shelter. She explained the in-house restaurant closing hours and menu options. She informed me of an event that was happening at the restaurant with live DJ music and highly recommended to make a reservation if I was going to dine in. She then walked me to the elevator and explained which floor I was going to stay. This was a nice touch to have so much personal attention to a solo guest at the hotel. The room: entering the hallway to my room, you are greeted by abstract carpets and colourful walls. The lights turn on automatically as you walk through the hallway. I enter my room and was blown away by the size, amendities and wall to ceiling windows. The iMac was great to perform iChat, free movies, TV and acts as my alarm clock too. The bed was perfect - hard and soft pillows. The key was the free wifi. The signal was so strong that I had a 1hour conversation to my family in Toronto, Canada via Skype. I was very impressed. Restaurant: I grabbed some takeaway from the in-hotel restaurant (pizza and salad). As i was waiting for my takeway, i occupied a table to wait. I was informed by the waiter that the table was needed for some other customers. Not a problem here as the waiter grabbed me a chair and offered me a drink on the house for moving and waiting for my takeway. Tres cool! Overall: I find that the customer service combined with the excellent facilities of the hotel made my Paris experience even more enjoyable. I highly recommend anyone to venture out of the main tourist city and visit Mama Shelter. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “stylish and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: anne1066
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and fast check in . My room on 7th floor was great, really quiet. Excellent shower. Annoying fridge system whereby you cannot put any of your own drinks in , so forget buying any food or wine to keep cool. Odd that there is a microwave which implies they don't mind you eating your own food, that fridge has to go.... It felt very safe and secure despite previous negative reviews. The key system to operate the lift ensures that no-one other than guests can use it. The area was a little difficult for me working miles away as it is at least a 10 min walk from the metro but if on a holiday rather than business then its a great area to be in.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: oscarpark8
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, modern and the bed was very comfortable. fantastic value for money will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “we love mama!”
Reviews.Author: wkcrook
Reviews.Content: what a brilliant hotel. we stayed for a couple of days in December and could not fault the place. the rooms were just right for us and for Paris very reasonable. the staff could not have been more helpful. the bar was buzzing in the evening and had a great feel to it with great cocktails. last but by no means least was the restaurant with excellent french cuisine. if in paris for a couple of days then this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: rgaggin
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at Mama Shelter. Friendly and helpful staff. Funky decor. Super comfortable bed! Quiet. Free movies. Bathroom was roomy, great shower. Would def recommend. The only drawback is the location (20th arrondissement). Try the nearby restaurant L'Ange Gardien.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Paris - trendy spot.”
Reviews.Author: wolf1980
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend of my 30th birthday in Paris and my friends and I all loved the hotel. You can take a bus downtown from right across the street. Takes a while though - but the room price is unbeatable. When I checked out, Monica Bellucci walked in for brunch with her two daughters. Seems like quite a hotspot. Great roof top chillout!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a great find!”
Reviews.Author: glong79
Reviews.Content: In August I took a trip tp Paris. A friend and I went and it was actually both both of our first time in the city. I actually had heard about this hotel from people in NYC and most people kept talking about how cool the bar was. I must say when we walked in it was definitely a pleasant suprise. The hotel has the great chic boutique vibe and there is also this kind of subtle cool hip hop feel as well. The rooms felt cool but simple, not overdone. I wasn't crazy about the shower only because it felt like water was getting all over the bathroom floor, but everything can't be perfect. The restaurant and bar were definitely the place to be and the food was great. They do a pizza bar in the afternoon that will hit the spot as well! The staff is nice, especially down in the bar. The hotel itself isn't in a heavy tourist zone so you feel like you are really gettting to see the city through the eyes of the locals. However you are just a quick bus or train ride from all major tourist attractions. I think the pricing is pretty good as well. The only reason I can't really comment on that is because this was a spur of the moment trip for us and we literally booked the tickets a week and a half before. enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Cool 'n Chic”
Reviews.Author: PegasusMiami
Reviews.Content: You stay at Mama Shelter because you want to since it's not centrally located. It's very "un-hotel" - from the reception desk, the elevators papered with trivia, the business center in the lobby (just two Macs on a big square table), and a bar & restaurant that are real crowd scenes. My room was very dark, especially the bathroom. Pity a woman who wants both space and light to put on her makeup. The plastic Batman masks that double as bedside lamp shades were funky and kept the room dark. There were few hangars in the open concept closet. I appreciated the microwave and sink built in to the wall unit although I'm not sure anyone ever used them. Bed was extremely comfortable. Air conditioning was strong which is essential for those hot summer nights. The hotel is far from the action, which makes it so appealing. No hordes of gawking tourists. No street noise (my room was exceptionally quiet.) No tour groups (thankfully.) No banging garbage trucks at 4 AM. Staff is young, friendly & eager to help. Hotel guests are either no-nonsense business types or well-dressed 30-somethings. Just wished the room would have been brighter.

Reviews.Title: “interesting discovery”
Reviews.Author: °°
Reviews.Content: Nice stay, good trendy concept. Went there with two friends, took the triple room. Bar and restaurant with several cosy corners, which really invites you to stay downstairs. Bar is rather expensive for what you yet, but worth trying. Interior has nice details and surprises everywhere. Hotel guests are a real mix of business people, couples, singles, etc. of all ages. Front desk girls could be a little more professional ; when leaving, we had the choice in the luggage depot which luggage we were going to take home ... Nevertheless, I would surely go back !

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Clean, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kwardell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in May this year. I was extraordinarily pleased with the front desk staff service. Our room was chic and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was impeccable. A few of my favorite amenities included Kiehls products and the internet in room. The hotel is between two major train stations and there are several restaurants and pastry shops on the way to the trains. We didn't try the restaurant down stairs but after about 8pm it seemed to be a very go-to trendy location. The overall location is quiet, we felt safe and had an easy time jumping on a train to explore the city from this hotel. I would stay here again. For the price, you really can't beat it in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Coming back”
Reviews.Author: swedishgeek
Reviews.Content: Yep, VERY nice hotel. Nothing wrong with the staff at all, quite contrary; friendly but not fawning over you. Just the right balance of professional but still personal. As a matter of fact, I'd say the staff was one of the biggest strengths. I don't know what the complaints are about... Maybe it's a Euro/American thing. Good breakfast and surprisingly quiet rooms. Clean and Tasteful bathrooms. At the price, the hotel is amazing. Drawbacks: Location is off, no doubt about it. The rooms, while good in almost every respect, are too dark. Design took over function in this respect.

Reviews.Title: “Rough around the edges, but good value”
Reviews.Author: barbaraGeneva
Reviews.Content: This new hotel in the upper regions of Paris is good value--the rooms are great, even the bargain rooms are large-ish, the queen-size beds are wonderful with good linens, clean, bathroom a delight with Kiehl's products and good shower. There are two problems: the staff---Parisian attitude as my partner put it. The front-desk staff were pleasant but overwhelmed and not very helpful (especially for taxis). The wait staff in the restaurant is hopeless. The restaurant(s) are very branchée, with the snob factor to prove it, but the service is disorganized and slow. The prices are very high--with a foie gras appetizer the same price as raw carrots. The second, and bigger problem with this hotel is the location--it is painful to fight traffic to get there, and no metro stop in the immediate vicinity. It is also very difficult to get a taxi out of the hotel, with hotel valet parking staff just standing around talking, leaving guests out on the street with luggage to hail their own taxis. When asked, the front desk staff refused to call a taxi on a Friday night saying it would be best just to wait for one to show up.(?!) So while the hotel itself is good value, it is not good value to eat there but you may find yourself stuck.

Reviews.Title: “Fot a hotel, Mama Shelter is a great hostel”
Reviews.Author: deCBA
Reviews.Content: I was amazed when reading the reviews of so many happy visitors of Mama Shelter. Obviously there's more people than I thought ready to forgive bad service as long as the place looks cool. Indeed the design is very nice, hip and trendy: lots of black, Mac screen on your room (you have to pay a deposit at reception if you want to use as PC), bathroom very neat, top quality toiletteries(only shower gel and shampoo though), beds are good. But quoting Philippe Starck himself, "Everything I designed was unnecessary", the room is full of silly lighting that doesn't really illuminate (putting make-up on at night is a challenge :-)), you have to look for long before finding the right light switch, the room started to smell like cigarettes if you turned the airco on, not to mention the toilet paper holder was installed uncorrectly, so every time you pull the paper, the rol flew the other side of the bathroom to land under the shower. There's a water cooker in the room, but you have to bring your own tea or coffee because there's none. When calling reception to ask for drinks that were not replaced in our mini bar, we were told that's normal, because the company that fills the minibars comes once a week! No, there's no room service. Internet at the "business centre" (two computers next to reception) was very slow, and one of the PC's actually didn't work. There's two special desks for your flights check-in, but connection is so slow that you may as well just do the line at the airport: seriously, it wook almost one hour to my friend flying to Canada to get her boarding passes printed. So service is basically inexistent at Mama Shelter, once you enter the hotel, you're on your own. Checking in took for ever: the girl (I don't think anyone among the personnel is older than 23) that checked me in had a lot of trouble to understand that I was with a group of friends that had already checked in and kept insisting I should get a newly booked room that wasn't mine. At the bar/restaurant, things didn't go better. Waiters don't come spontaneously to ask if you want anything, you have to call them, I realized after half hour sitting there. Once they finally got my order, it took 45' to bring carrots with a dipping sauce! I was curious how long it would take if I had asked something that involved cooking... When my friends joined for more drinks, things didn't get better. The waiter kept coming back and asking again what we wanted because he never got the order right, so some got their drinks half hour later than the rest. At this point, some had enough and left to dine somewher else. Those who staid regreted it: the pasta we order was overcooked and just about edible and served in a cacerole (all portions together) which the waiter just left on the table. Not only he wouldn't serve the plates, he took the top of the cacerole with him and he didn't even leave a spoon, so he left us there with the pasta cooling down while we tried to put it on the plates with fork and knife. At this point we were reminding the waiter for the 3rd time of the bottle of wine we had ordered. By the 5th time, no wine yet and thirsty, we just paid and left to have our drinks somewhere else. Those reviews mentioning the brunch and breakfast is excellent astonish me: food is just OK, but price-quality relation is not balanced. If you want to enjoy a proper brunch in a Paris hotel, try the Kube hotel in the 18e arrondissement. Yes, the bar is very cool too and the locals visiting are also cool looking people, but Paris is big enough to find other cool and expensive places where you can actually have good food AND decent service. If you had a busy day and would like to sleep, you won't before 2am: the noise and music from the bar won't let you. For a Paris hotel it is not expensive, but for hostel service quality it is. I did have a great time and fun with my friends in Paris, but the hotel didn't add much to that. And if you are a design lover, you may as well just go to the Mama Shelter bar (don't bother eating there), have a drink, enjoy the atmosphere and go back to sleep somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive luxury boutique hotel, unusal location”
Reviews.Author: sermann
Reviews.Content: Very impressed by the Mama Shelter, we had one of the larger rooms (Mama Deluxe) which was really nice and very well decorated. All amenities were present, including a very comfortable bed with satin linens. Friendly and attentive staff at the reception, at the restaurant and at the in-house pizzeria. Excellent breakfast buffet. Live bands on the two evenings we stayed there (some kind of ethnic hip-hop on Friday and a Neil Young-special on Saturday) and suggestions for events downtown written on large mirrors on each floor. The hotel is quite far from the tourist locations, but there is well connected bus stop nearby and the subway stations are not too far. The city is building a Velib station in front of the hotel, where you can rent bicycles by the 1/2 hour and drop them off anywhere in Paris, if you want. Large underground parking available, for a fee… No room service, but the pizzeria will prepare nice take-away for you... Might become my favorite hotel in Paris...

Reviews.Title: “Who says old Multi Storey Car Parks are dull???”
Reviews.Author: Hookyface
Reviews.Content: If you're a solo traveller or it's your first time to Paris. This might not be the best option unless you've got an adventuresome spirit. If you're a couple, have a blast, explore together and enjoy some giggles! This is a fun area, with true Parisien essence! I can say for the solos in search of lurv, that some of the folks hanging around the bar and restaurant on a weekend are true authentic Parisien chique! The food is delicious in the restaurant and the bar staff can pull together quite a few signature cocktails. It's more upmarket than you're traditional French bistro but it's all well prepared, great for ambience and if you're waiter is a little surly, it's nothing to do with the place. If you've been to Paris before, lived there, know the place then meander and explore a different quartier without being ripped off in tourist cafes and listening to droning tourist accents bang on about Baudelaire, even though he's genius. Though you may hear those accents close by as you visit Jim Morrison's grave in nearby Pere la Chaise. Beware though not all crowds around a gravestone are there because someone is famous, some are actually attending a funeral!! You need to walk a little for a Metro stop, but isn't that the beauty of Paris that you can... anyway if you're visiting why you not walking anyway or using a more eco friendly Velob!! And you you're a business man hail a cab on the corner and give your receipt to the company if you're in that much of a rush!! I could say something like prior preparation and slow down but I'll decline... I love this hotel.... off the beaten track and an excellent opportunity to explore a city I love in a fun, affordable way.... I saw someone complain about the fact there was only liquid soap but it's Kiehls and usually deliciously refined and exotic smelling.... so much lovelier than the usual hotel stuff smelling of Men's cologne! Lastly play with the masks and find a new side to yourself! Enjoy.....

Reviews.Title: “Mama looks after you”
Reviews.Author: rafkam
Reviews.Content: First things first: you need to put things in perspective when thinking about staying here. The location is not ideal, but there's plenty to explore for the more adventurous. On the other hand, for what I would rate 4.5 star quality accommodation in Paris, the price cannot be beat! If this is your first trip to Paris, do not stay here. You will not get a romantic view out your window, no cute boulangeries and flower shops and art galleries around. The metro stop is a 10-15 minute walk, then you need to make connections to get to most places, and although the bus takes you from the doorstep to the Louvre, it's still a 40-minute ride. However, if this is not your first trip to Paris, you're young (or young at heart), and would like to go off the beaten path, then this is the place for you! Rooms are small, but exquisitely furnished (it is Philippe Starck after all), great fun with the plastic masks dubbing as bedside lamps. There's free wi-fi everywhere and an iMac in every room, complete with free on-demand movies, tips on points of interest in the area and an ibooth: you can take pictures from the iMac, e-mail them to yourself, and perhaps have them screened at the restaurant downstairs. Great fun! The décor is really trendy, with artwork everywhere, on the carpets, ceilings, lift. The whole black theme makes the place a bit dark, so perhaps more suited for a winter trip to Paris, although the rooftop terrace is night on a cool evening. We stayed in the 5th floor, and although we could hear music from the bar, it closed fairly early, around 1:00AM on weekends, so not too much trouble. Reception were quick to check us in, and equally efficient to change our room when, after walking in detecting a strong stale cigarette smoke in the room. Bathroom was very nice, with good rain shower and Kiehl's toiletries. Towels were changed every night, without having to request. The hotel bar/restaurant is a hotspot, and you are advised to book for every meal in advance. Menu is small, but very nice, brunch was superb (see separate restaurant review). No complaints, really, only a few minor quibbles, like not enough staff at reception at checkout time, area around shower gets a little wet, etc... People looking for a more classic hotel experience might not appreciate this place. But with their pricing policy, I believe them to be catering for the 20-35 age group, who will no doubt love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy luxury at a great price”
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Paris at Mama Shelter and it was a great way to end a vacation that started and ended in Paris. The hotel was extremely comfortable despite the rather small room which included a mini kitchette with bar sink, microwave, and minibar. The bed was so comfortable and had wonderful pillows and luxurious sheets. The shower was awesome and they provide Kiehl's bath products. We enjoyed the leafy rooftop terrace which has a ping pong table, canvas sling chairs, and two lounge beds. The hotel is far from the main tourist areas of the city. You might want to think about this when considering the hotel because of the amount of time you will spend on the metro. We found a number of interesting cafes near the hotel although many were closed during August. The hotel is very hip and modern but not all the guests are hipsters. However, if you prefer a traditional hotel experience with traditional decor, this is not the place for you. But, if you want to see and enjoy another side of Paris, this is a great hotel in the 20th arrondissement.

Reviews.Title: “Design over comfort”
Reviews.Author: CharshankRedemption
Reviews.Content: I found this great deal on the hotels website ('I love Paris'-deal, 99 euros for the room, including breakfast, metro tickets and a throw away camera) that couldn't compete with any other hotel prices in Paris. The hotel looks fantastic and the staff is very good and very helpful, but I found the room to be a bit overly designed. For instance, the only part of the mirror in the bathroom you could use was next to the toilet, so you would be standing almost into the toilet when I took out my contact lenses. Also, the shower design wasn't that practical. The concrete walls made the rooms look a bit cold. Also, there were so many light switches(6 or 7)! I can imagine that for solo business travellers, this hotel is perfect: great restaurant, computer use in your room (the tv doubles as a computer), easy accessible (and free) wi-fi, free in house movies. But if you want to experience Paris by night and get out of your hotel, this is not your neighbourhood.
