It's improving, but when the metros stop at night and you need to take a 20 minute taxi drive, I can imagine better hotel options. It was nice staying her once, but next time, I'll look for a more central spot.

Reviews.Title: “Oh MAMA! I miss you already!”
Reviews.Author: Design-Family
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Mama Shelter for 15 nights while in Paris for work. What an incredible experience it was! From the very beginning, working with Amel at reservations was easy ... she was quick and responsive, and when I explained that I would be working during my stay (and that quiet at night was important), she assured me that my room would provide a respite. Upon arrival at the hotel, I was greeted with warmth at reception, and was told that my room was ready for me, despite my very early arrival at the hotel (11 am). My 'single' room (actually, a full size bed) was booked at the lowest rate available - 79 EUR per night. What a great value! I was located on the 7th (top) floor of the hotel, adjacent to the beautiful (and very underused/private) roof terrace! A bright sunny room awaited, immaculate and spotless - perfect and consistent and high speed wifi, the imac TV, very cool surroundings, a great bathroom, and most importantly, total quiet (thanks also to concrete walls). The room could not have been more perfect, with large windows to the sunny exterior. The service at the hotel was amazing ... I always felt that I was staying at a small 'boutique' hotel, not a large hotel (which Mama Shelter actually is). The generosity of spirit at the reception was incredible - never frazzled, always relaxed, helpful, kind, patient. A continuation of the initial contact with Amel and the reservations department. By the way, any 'hiccup' that I encountered or any request put forth (few, as everything was near perfect!!!) was responded to IMMEDIATELY - not in half an hour, with another call, but AT THAT MOMENT. Hard to believe such good service still exists! Another huge plus is the restaurant - after being out all day, returning at 10:30, it was great (particularly as a solo traveler) to be able to change and go downstairs the the vibrant, loud, fun, lively restaurant and have dinner at the bar. The food is excellent, service is quick, the bartenders and servers are fantastic, and it makes for a great way to end the day. You can even connect to the wifi there to check up on things if need be. There's a small laundry if needed, very convenient for longer stays. In a fabulous city that has great hotels for huge sums, it is difficult to find a hotel that offers good value for money; and forget about great service and amenities. Mama Shelter bucks the trend by offering all of that and MORE! There is no gym at the hotel, but day passes and monthly passes can be purchased at the neighboring Club Med Gym just down the street - very convenient (note: almost no hotels in Paris have gyms!) This hotel is a perfect place for the design oriented who have been to Paris before. For those arriving for a first time visit, it may be difficult to 'get' the location, which is perfect for those that are not put off by being a bit outside of St. Germain, etc.. But the hotel is close enough to Bastille, Marais, etc. - particularly if you are on bike, as I was. Thanks to all at Mama Shelter for a productive working trip and for a great and unexpectedly relaxing stay - I'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “What an Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rundj190454
Reviews.Content: To be honest the location is not good, BUT you're in Paris and for the price you pay it's more than worth it + the restaurant got a very nice menu+good size room ! VERY FASHION! Did love my stay !

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: julianiels
Reviews.Content: excellent sleeping quality in very nice beds, very very clean (and i have a hight standard), great beauty products in the bathroom. nice design, funky bar. Minus points: overpriced breakfast (15 euros) and the bar which has a terrace can be noisy. overall: perfect, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we found it sooner!!”
Reviews.Author: vesperalley
Reviews.Content: Its hard to say just how good this hotel is... truly! Loved almost everything about our stay at Mama Shelter. Yes the location leaves a lot to be desired (its about a 10 minute walk from the nearest metro) but its worth the walk. The hotel does not look like much from the outside but as you approach it from the street you get a glimpse of the restaurant and you know that it is something special. Yes the hotel does look like a car park from the outside (which it was) but just wait and see what is lurking behind the doors. Everything in this hotel is the work of someone special. The detail is beyond reproach. The amount of detail is unquestionable, which makes it hard to pack everything into a review. The staff were very helpful. We arrived at the hotel a little early though and our room was not ready (we requested a room on a higher floor as to avoid any noise.... this is our thing!!) we were able to leave out luggage and arranged to come back later to check in correctly. We arrived back at the hotel and we were given our luggage, the lift was called for us and we were told to have a nice stay. The lift was bright pink, with lots of random quotes on the wall.... very designer. The corridor to the room was quite dark, but again this added to the whole atmosphere. Once we got to out room we found almost everything to be perfect (a few things a miss but more on that later). So the room was fairly small, but compared to other rooms in Europe this is pretty standard, and with being from the UK we are more than use to it. The lighting in the room was fairly low and again this all adds to the atmosphere. There was a Mac on the wall of the bed room and this was used for the TV/Radio/Internet etc, the range of channels was pretty standard and we had to leave a deposit with reception to gain a keyboard for the internet. Wifi was free and easy enough to log onto with our iphones. The bed was big and the pillows were full, very good quality bedding and had a fantastic nights sleep. The bathroom was clean and light with lots of space. The shower was lovely and powerful. the only thing missing was a robe, and there was no soap! We would stay here again the price was good and the location was not enough to put us off! There is a lots of road works outside the hotel. But again we didn't hear any of this once in the hotel. Only bad point are: when we tried to book into the restaurant we were told that is was fully booked. As in the whole restaurant. We were not told by reception that it gets busy and we were not asked if we wanted to book on arrival. In the rooms there was a kettle but no cups/refreshments. There was a microwave but not a single plate/fork/anything. So apart from that we were pretty happy with the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: HanneleD
Reviews.Content: Mama Shelter has been designed by Philippe Starck and you can see that! The rooms are so cool, all black and dark grey except for the huge comfortable white bed. There is even a black flower in the bathroom. Bedside lamps are like carneval masks. Absolutely loved the room! And the price for Paris wasn't bad at all. Coctails in the bar were very expensive though. Having lived in Paris before for years, I also like the neighbourhood: although right next to the hotel there isn't much, the buzzy areas of the 20th and 10th arrondissements aren't far. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Mama!”
Reviews.Author: jcjojozep
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Mama Shelter. My daughter is a big interior design and Philippe Starck fan so was very keen to stay here a night when we came to Paris. We were not disappointed. The ambience of this minimalist hotel is very laid back and cool, understated yet funky! Hard to explain. You need to experience it! The service was excellent, staff very helpful and the hotel very clean and well maintained. Breakfast was delicious next morning - a relatively simple buffet selection that seemed just right. and the fruit salad was beautiful. Yes it is a little out of the way, but don't let that deter you. We walked with our luggage from the Metro and it was OK. The nearby cemetery is very interesting, by the way, and you can visit famous graves like Chopin and James Morrison.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stays at mama shelter”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_Peponas
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at mama shelter three times in the last year. Have totally enjoyed every moment at the hotel, same for my friends and family. Very good value for money. Very nice design, very comfortable beds, excellent showers, very friendly staff. When I had to cancel one night due to heavy snow, they returned the money to my credit card despite their rules!!!

Reviews.Title: “Funky but not practical”
Reviews.Author: Luckystrikes
Reviews.Content: Hotel is cool and stylish but totally impractical. Really dark rooms, very small and hot, even with our deluxe room. The bar / restaurant is fab, we found the service really good, the music and atmosphere were great. Unfortunately wouldn't recommend the hotel unless you're looking for something funky and off the beaten track. We found that closest metro station is Alexander Dumas (10 min walk) which is on the blue line, and 2 trains from there to main centre attractions. Alternatively the 76 bus from outside the hotel, though takes between 30-40 mins depending on traffic.

Reviews.Title: “If you haven't booked you cant sit down!”
Reviews.Author: lionmills
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mama Shelter for 2 nights in a triple room with my mum and sister. The room was lovely. It is quite minimal but had everything we needed. The hotel is situated about 10 minutes walk from the nearest metro, and a 25 minute bus ride into central Paris. For ease we thought we would eat at the hotel restaurant in the evening. We went down at around 8.30 and were told it was fully booked, but we could eat at the bar or back area. We sat at the back, and ordered our food and wine. Half way through our glass of wine, a rather surly waitress came over and told us our table was taken and we couldn't sit there. We explained we had ordered food, but would move if she needed us to. We were put on a bar table which wasn't conducive to eating dinner. It only just had space for our plates, we had to put the water, wine and bread on a chair at the side. The meal could not be savored, and for over 90 euros we were extremely disappointed. On the final day of our stay, we went for a walk around the area in the morning, then came back to check out at 12pm. We had organised to leave at 12.30, and thought we would sit on the terrace or in the bar, and have a coffee while we waited. Again we were told the terrace and bar were fully booked. There is no lounge area for hotel guests, the only seating is at the computer table, not the sort of thing we had in mind. The general overview we got, was that the restaurant and bar have priority over the hotel. On the website, the information and pictured lead you to believe that guests have access to all the facilities, but in actual fact this proved misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Lively Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasonH69
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel if you want a bit of nightlife with your room. DJs spin all weekend until about 1:30am so I'd suggest a room on a high floor on the opposite side of the restaurant if you care to sleep before then. The staff were all wonderful and spoke very good English. My only real complaint about the hotel is that they don't offer room service yet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette31
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed when I walked through the front door of this very funky hotel. There is a relaxed feel and we received a warm welcome. The rooms are clean and modern, very comfortable beds and great shower. We also had lunch in the restaurant which is really cool and well designed, great bar too. The only drawback is the location. It is quite out of the way and the nearest metro station is a good 10 minute walk. We ended up getting a lot of taxis which are very expensive in Paris. Also, there is tram line under construction which caused heavy traffic at all times. The hotel itself could not be faulted though. It wouldn't be ideal for older travellers or those with children as the bar is very lively and open until 2am but ask for a room on a higher floor and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay (if you adjust your expectations)”
Reviews.Author: Newfoundlander709
Reviews.Content: I think the comment that sums it up best is "The place was great, but I would not recommend it to my mother in law" or even my high-maintenance friends who expect some sort of Vegas type experience requesting hundreds of little extras at every hotel. One other poster pointed this out as well - I prefer to move under the radar most of the time, minding my own business. I've lived in central Paris and make regular visits and (I think) relatively low maintenance, so I prefer to be left alone by the staff. I felt well served (see exception below) and was impressed with the decor. I'm usually not high on the arty-design hotel stuff, and think it's mostly just an excuse to overcharge, but the atmosphere in this hotel worked for me. The room was cool. Small... but cool. If you want room to move around, then book a suite or else you'll be disappointed. The Mac TV is cool. The room was quiet and the bed was the most comfortable I've had in Paris. The Kiehl products are a nice touch for the wife, and Bar is well worth a night (even if you don't stay here). The location is good if you are either exploring the 20th (Pere Lachaise is nearby) or you are okay with Public Transit. The metro is a bit of a walk (not far, but I wouldn't want to walk it in the rain). Getting to the centre of Paris is easy, though. The line 76 bus runs right in front of the hotel and connects via Rue Charonne/Pl. Bastille/Rue St. Antoine and follows Rue Rivoli through to the Louvre in about 25mins that goes by quickly. You can get out at Bastille or Chatelet to connect to the rest of the City without a problem. Reception Staff was a mixed bag. When asking the lady at the desk about the best way to get to the airport on a weekday afternoon, the staff appeared to be a little more fashion than function - had I been new to the city, the answer would have thrown me a bit. Although the guy on duty the night we arrived seemed well aware of the restaurants within walking distance. The free internet in the reception area was also useful (for things like planning a trip to the airport). The one downer for me was the service in the resto/cafe. We were ignored for a while as we settled in for a coffee before heading out for the afternoon - I got the feeling some minor crisis was happening behind the scenes, but still how hard is it ask if we need a menu or just drinks? For the prices you pay in there, the service could (should) have been better. All in all, I think this place is well worth what we paid (got a deal I think since we booked relatively early) and I (generally) wouldn't have any problem recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone, perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Himeno
Reviews.Content: I treated my girlfriend to a weekend here so we could explore more of the 20th arrondissment. We had been living in a tiny student room in Bagneux for 4 weeks before coming here so had already seen a lot of Paris. We had a terrace room which we got at a reduced rate because we booked ahead a bit. The hotel is a little out of the way from the usual hotel circuit and probably best for people who appreciate what the area has to offer which is distinct from the usual Paris tourist experience. The positives were the location for us is where we wanted to explore the more down to earth east side of Paris. The rooms were super quiet, the walls are polished concrete. The decor is modern and imaginative, the beds and linen super comfortable, the staff are discreet and the lowish lighting and decor makes you feel able to just slip in and out without too much fuss. I think there is a bit of a cultural misunderstanding with many reviews I have read from people who feel they are being ignored in establishments in Paris. I actually prefer to be ignored a bit early on while you get comfortable in a space, I dont want someone gushing over me with fake friendliness. However there is a fine line between being given space and being ignored so I appreciate some reviewers may have genuinely felt put out in some places in Paris The downsides of the hotel were the kitchenette has no utensils or cutlery so very limited ability to prepare food. The wireless internet keyboard we were supplied with was arcane and fiddly to use. The restaurant and bar had a great design and ambience but we felt the prices were a bit upmarket for us. We are cheapskates though I have to say. Overall we had a very romantic weekend here, out every night till 5-6am exploring the bars and clubs, felt very safe on the street and enjoyed the ambience of this place a lot. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool design”
Reviews.Author: CURBYOURLARRYDAVID
Reviews.Content: Very chic, interesting and intelligently designed. Very lovely service, really attentive and friendly. Great busy bar and restaurant (although a little chi chi for us). Small, dark and adventurous rooms for a dirty weekend away. VERY COMFORTABLE BEDS Next to the cematary where Jim Morrisson is buried but a bit of a hike to anything else interesting in Paris, hense the very reasonable room prices. If you don't mind being 10 mins from the action/attractions this is a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and Unique but Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Mama Shelter and generally had an okay experience. We found the staff to be generally helpful. The hotel is a bit out of the way from many major tourist attractions. The nearest metro station is about a 15 minute walk away, but the 76 bus that passes within a block the hotel provides an easy route to Louvre-Rivoli and other more central areas. We enjoyed being in a location that was more removed from areas with more tourists. The hotel interior is quite interesting and eye-catching, although our room was very small. The bathroom was adequate, although the shower was a bit small. Water from the shower also sprayed out on the floor far too easily. The TVs in the hotels are all iMacs, and iMacs are also available for use in the lobby. The hotel has free Internet, which was uneven in quality in our experience. We were able to access the Internet only sporadically. We had one meal in the hotel restaurant. I found the hotel restaurant to be mediocre and overpriced, although my husband had a meal that he enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with top design”
Reviews.Author: VivianeZhu
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the hotel and the experience was nice. If you like something cool and fashion, that is your choice. It is not like most of the european hotels. WIth the amercian style, the hotel is a little dark. The lamp is made of funny mask and there is the iMac TV. In the room you can use the micro-wave and there is some kitchen accessories. The toilette products are Kileh's. I dont like the frigo, as u can not put ur foods or drinks in it. It likes a distributor, where you can buy drinks and pay for the hotel. Just for the location is not very good, a little far from the M3 metro, around 10-15 mins for walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great interieur design fails to compensate for other shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: TLANYI
Reviews.Content: We had read about Mama Shelter in a magazine, which highly recommended it as "the must-stay" for design hotel lovers. Our experience was overall disappointing. We loved the design on the inside, in particular the restaurant/bar. The outside of the hotel resembles more a school or community center than a hip hotel. Service was extremely poor, from the very start, when staff refused to help with luggage (in the general absence of a bell desk). No room service, unreliable cleaning service. The worst however was clearly the location. Unless you have business in the area, i recommend against staying there. You will pay EUR10-20 taxi fare to the main sites in Paris. Public transport is limited with the exception of a bus that leaves every 15 mins. The neighborhood is very local, rather suburban, nothing to do, nothing to look at (our deluxe room view was to the rail road tracks). For the price you pay at Mama Shelter, stay in 3-star downtown and visit the bar/restaurant once on your trip to not miss out on the unquestionably Starck touch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing fun, unique and quirky hotel, would definitely recommend for a short stay!”
Reviews.Author: CSMM82
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend staying here, it's a funky location in East Paris, a bit out of the way from the central tourist areas yes but there is a metro just a short walk away. Great value as we got a special offer and an amazing restaurant & bar with a DJ etc and fantastic service. If you are looking for a standard hotel this isn't for you, the rooms aren't really practical and are quite hot and dark but they are so much fun and have yummy Kiehl's products too. We came as a group of 3 couples, we all loved it but would all say this hotel is ideal for a short stay of a night or two. You don't even really need to go anywhere else as it's a great night at the hotel and really busy with lots of locals, a mix of young and older crowds, though the bar and restaurant are quite pricey, a cocktail was €14. Dinner and drinks came to €60 a head so not too bad, (the scallops are gorgeous). Breakfast looked lovely too but again a bit more expensive. They also seemed pretty children friendly as there was a large family celebrating a child's Birthday on Sunday afternoon too. For a fun, cool, quirky and different experience I would say do it.. I definitely hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay there for the coolness of it - don't expect it to be either practical or remarkable service-wise”
Reviews.Author: VictorJessica
Reviews.Content: If you are a looking for a hip big city stay, if you are an architecture and design fan, this is a fantastic place to experience. If the Pere Lachaise cemetery is on your list of "must see"s while in Paris, the location is another argument for it. The value for money factor is not bad either. However, if you are looking for a convenient place to stay and explore central Paris and/or you expect to be pampered by the staff, I would recommend you to choose another place. Afterall, the coolness of Mama Shelter can almost entirely be experienced by hanging at the bar while listening to the DJ cuts in a week-end evening. A detail observation made by my spouse: the semi-darkness is a part of the room design, but if you are in need of proper lighting for work or applying your make-up, you might find it rather irritating.

Reviews.Title: “hip hotel, great value, excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: zympo
Reviews.Content: trendy hotel, perfect for one night if you are waiting for a flight. the restaurant and atmosphere is perfect. internet is a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “A Fun, Unique Property - Away From The Hustle and Bustle, But Not Too Far Away”
Reviews.Author: Jabrs1643
Reviews.Content: The Mama Shelter was a fun, unique, and comfortable property that was not only a great value, but a fun location for a solo traveler, sightseeing family, or romantic couple. I had stumbled across the Mama Shelter website when reading about hotel design, and decided to book two nights for my trip to Paris. The price was very reasonable (less than the Marriotts or Hiltons I had researched), and seemed to offer some great amenities for the value. I arrived in Paris via train from London, and took the Metro from Gare Du Nord station to Porte De Bagnolet, which was the nearest station to the Mama Shelter. As other guests have pointed out, the property is not in the center of Paris, and it is a bit of a walk (I'd say 15-20min. from the metro station). However, while the area looks like it would be "shady," I found there were some great restaurants, shops, and incredibly friendly people you pass on the walk to the hotel. Checking-in at the Mama Shelter was easy as can be, and while I would not say those working the front desk are perfectly fluent in English, they certainly speak more than enough to provide information about the hotel and how to get around. I was given a room on the second floor (both the front door to the hotel and the elevator are accessible by room key), and found my room to be very comfortable. The bathroom included a very nice shower, heated towel rack, and lovely amenities; the bedroom had a unique design with a very comfortable bed and functional work-space. Above the desk was a large iMac computer, which was controlled via remote. This could be used to watch TV, movies, browse the web, or find out information regarding the hotel and local area. You can also ask the front desk for a wireless keyboard to use with the computer (you just are required to put down a deposit in case it is broken), but the rental cost is free. Additionally, the lobby includes two iMac computers that are free to use. Since I did not dine or use the bar in the hotel, I cannot comment on the quality of food, though both nights the bar and restaurant seemed incredibly popular. Near the hotel were a few bars/nightclubs as well as restaurants, so if a trip into the center of Paris wasn't your ideal evening, you would not need to go very far at all. Additionally, I will comment that the staff at the Mama Shelter were very friendly and fun to chat with, and made a guest truly feel welcome. So as long as a short trek to the nearest metro isn't a problem, the Mama Shelter is a fun, unique property at a great price. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mama Mia!”
Reviews.Author: citrusboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during fashion week and the place was crawling with models and fashion execs all week. The Hotel is away from the heart of Paris but considering the noise that you WON'T be hearing while going to sleep, that's a good thing no? a brisk 10 minute walk to the metro and you can be anywhere you want in minutes. The vibe is happening. Not the in your face happening like the Hudson Hotel in NYC buit more like the Mondrian, Viceroy or London West Hollywood in Los Angeles. The rooms are nice and quite comfortable. SUPER Quiet. Odd, because right next to the hotel is a rail line for, I think, the RER. I havent heard anything yet and I have been here 4 days already. Restaurant is excellent but gets JAM Packed, so reserve. No problem if you didn't, but be prepared to sit at the bar. Everyone is SUPER friendly as well. So you can choose to stay at your 250 euro hotel in the 8th (We were going to stay at the Monna Lisa) or you stay at the Uber happening Mama Shelter for 89 euros in the 20th. Me, Everytime I get to Paris, I am staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Mama I'm coming home.....”
Reviews.Author: erinaburns
Reviews.Content: Walking in to the Mama Shelter, I thought I had been transported back to the Paramount or Hudson Hotel in NYC. Mama Shelter employs the same hip, modern decor that is de rigeur in the US boutique hotel scene. The rooms are larger than most typical Parisian hotel rooms and also are equipped with the latest in high tech equipment; for example, there is an IMAC with a TV in each room, and IMACs in the "business center" in the lobby. There is also free internet access in each room, and the front desk will give you an access code for the lobby. The rooms also are furnished with a comfy bed, modern shower, and high thread count towels. The hotel also has a hip restaurant that is packed with hotel and non-hotel patrons every night. The only drawback is that the hotel is located in the "up and coming" 20th arrondisement which means you have to take the metro everywhere, but it is right up the street. Finally, this hotel is such a great vlaue right now; my husband and I booked it for $89 Euros per night. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “TRENDY”
Reviews.Author: shawnmontreal
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on a "Conciergerie" website, definitely to be experienced if you are of the trendy "want to be impressed" breed. Located in the rapidly developing area in the 20th arrondissement of Paris, it is a great place to go to a little removed from the hustle and bustle of central Paris. Easily accessible by subway, this hotel provides you with a "quartier" experience. As you enter, the decor and staff are Warhol worthy. The building is concrete so you can not hear the next rooms evening entertainment program. The rooms are on the small side and a little dark, but equipped with portable lighting and a Mac screen from where to work directly on E-Mail and surf the net. It also doubles as a TV screen from which you can access all of your entertainment and communication needs. Good quality bath and shower products. Would recommend thay have tissues in the rooms and also face cloths. A five minute walk away is a marvelous brasserie called Le Chantefable where great food, wine and service is a rendez-vous. Le Cafe Noir which is close by is both pretentious and expensive. This hotel is only a year old and still has some work to do for top grade but well on its` way with young, friendly end enthousiastic staff and an experienced Manager keeping watch on his flock. Definitely an experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay and would definately come again”
Reviews.Author: MissTravellerLondon
Reviews.Content: Very trendy and buzzy hotel, only been open a year, more N.Y.C than Paris but we still loved it. Hotel room quite small as we expected, but adequate and comfortable. We ate dinner in the restaurant, which had a great atmosphere and pretty decent food although quite expensive for what you get. Metro stations all short walk away, so easy to get around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: cdcdcd
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this arty fun hotel. Staff were friendly, and reserved us a car parking space plus adjoining rooms for the children. The room had an apple mac tv and lots of fun features. it was clean and the kingsize bed was comfortable. 10 minute walk to the metro in a busy street, so no problem coming home late at night. Fantastic for a visit to Pere Lachaise cemetary which is minutes away. Our only criticism was that the breakfast was way too expensive - better to go to the lovely patisserie one street away.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun, great decor .. but getting there ?”
Reviews.Author: MaxHeadroom
Reviews.Content: My first impression: Hip boutique hotel offering santised English-speak & Californian-style home comforts to far-flung tourists wary of rough Parisien-types. So having got over my first impression this hotel is great fun and definitely worth a night's stay. Loved the black decor and bare (black) concrete walls, huge comfortable bed, quirky lights, amazing mirrors, neat Apple TV. Bathroom cramped but fine, great shower (actually the water doesn't go everywhere outside the glass screen), but why American toiletries ? This is Paris - the French make great toiletries ! Bar / restaurant has a range of seating and is very comfortable. There's an outside terrance in the sun too. Great buzz on a Sat night - but book if you want to eat other than at the bar - this place fills with local Parisiens. Food and drink is very expensive compared with elsewhere, but you're paying to enjoy the atmosphere too. Location is awkward - it's not close to any metro, but I found Gambetta is probably the best-served and nearest. But better still hire a Velib and cycle around - there are 3 Velib bays nearby. Hotel is on the edge of Pere Lachaise cemetry & can recommend an hour or so walking round that for something different to do.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel - just dont pay for the extras”
Reviews.Author: rastadaddy
Reviews.Content: We loved Mama Shelter. The hotel strikes a good balance between a business hotel and a trendy boutique hotel. As a couple on a 'romantic break' to Paris we felt comfortable, but dont expect chintzy decor and pictures of couples kissing by the Eiffel Tower. This hotel is made for urbanites who want to explore and get a feel for a different side of Paris - there is a blackboard by the lift with local events and attractions updated daily. In fact every surface in the hotel has something drawn/written on it. The staff were great. The rooms were immaculate, and The Bed! The most comfortable beds in Paris. Great features in the room. Quirky and stylish. Some people think the rooms are too dark, but they may have missed the curtain and the window and the lights on the walls and headrest which can be adjusted. The bathroom was really nice and we loved the rain forest shower. You do need to remember it is a hotel.. ie. anything you buy in the bar or restaurant is over-priced. A can of Sprite for 3 euros, Breakfast for 20... But there are plenty of bars, cafes and brasseries in the area, so there's no need to stay in the hotel anyway. You may want to avoid Mama Shelter if your easily annoyed by hipsters - you know, weird haircuts, funny clothes and an air of "Im cooler than everyone else" about them. But hey. You take the rough with the smooth!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Joan_in_Belgium
Reviews.Content: I booked Mama Shelter based on the reviews I'd seen on TripAdvisor. I knew that it wasn't in the center, but I didn't see that as a problem. I had family from California in tow and they were really 'wowed'. The decor was quirky, but the rooms were spacious for Paris. Yes, they thought the walk to the metro (a 5 minute brisk walk) a bit far (wait, we're not driving into the center of Paris?), but we all agreed that it was a good value. (Our rate was €108, for luxe rooms) The room was very stark (Starck?), but fun. The Kiehl's products in the bath were a nice touch. I drove into Paris, and from the ring it was an easy drive. The parking was very clean and secure. I'll stay here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: soph7789
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting too much from this hotel as we got a really good rate. About 90 euros a night. I thought it was going to be a bit average. But i was really pleasantly surprised. The room was small (like all in Paris) but the amenities were really good. The bathroom was nice and very clean and the bed sheets were wonderful. It is a little bit dark in the room if you don't open the curtains. But with them open it is not an issue. I had stayed at the Westin in Paris already this month and i enjoyed Mama Shelter much more. The only issue is that it is quite far out 20eme but there are two metro stops nearby so it is not a problem if you allow for the extra travel time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vibes - Comfortable Stay - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa_Traveler_66
Reviews.Content: I searched out different hotels for my latest trip and the Mama Shelter did not disappoint. Affordability in Paris is always a challenge so being a bit away from the centre of the city was not a problem. I would definitely recommend it and can't wait until their NY property opens up.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: jrnlmkr
Reviews.Content: i loved mamashelter. every review has gone on about the cool design, so i'll skip anything about that. except to say, every detail is accounted for. what else did i like? the neighborhood which was very convenient to everything by metro. i loved that there were no tourists about--i never ever once saw anyone walking with a guidbook the whole time i was there. the front desk staff was warm and helpful and patient when i insisted in speaking to them in french. one lovely guy, when he saw i was struggling with the language but wanted to continue to try, told me not to worry, take my time and give it a shot. however, if you do not speak french, everyone on staff spoke marvelous english. i was confused about a few things. there was an electric tea pot in the room, but only glasses alongside. i travel with teabags, so the hot water was a plus, but had to drink with a towel wrapped around the too hot glass. warning: if you have an early flight out, your only option is to take a cab. they will graciously call you one if you give them a head's up the night before, but know this: the cabs start their meter from when they leave the depot. my driver arrived early, didn't come in to tell the desk he was there and insisted i pay the ten euros racked up on the ticking meter before i'd even gotten in. no pay, no airport. better to book a later flight and take the roissy bus from from the opera subway. also, if you have color treated hair, bring your own shampoo. mamashelter thoughtfully uses kiehl's products, but the olive oil shampoo they provide leaves my hair both greasy and frizzy, a tough combination. also, if you like bar soap, bring some, as there is only body wash and the additional kiehl's products in the shop downstairs are very pricey. my favorite moment at the hotel? i'd bought some take away at the local shops and needed a fork to take to my room. a restaurant waiter got one for me asked if i also needed a serviette (napking) and a K-nife, pronounced with two syllables and a hard k. he went so far out of his way to be helpful and his charming pronunciation made my day. make sure you check out the activity suggestions scrawled on the mirrors by the elevators on each floor. and bring your computer, the wireless connection is flawless.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel or a club?”
Reviews.Author: Trippenhuis
Reviews.Content: Despite the old adage, if you have nothing good to say, don't say anything at all, I feel compelled to write a review of this hotel. And yes, you have guessed right, it's not going to be good. Let's start with the plus points. The hotel is reasonably priced, particularly for Paris, and the rooms spotlessly clean. If you are into quirky design, there were definitely enough interesting features in both the room and the hotel itself. The reception staff were helpful and friendly. So far we have good value, cleanness, original design and obliging staff. And this point, I can see you asking, what is wrong with this hotel? Right. I could have lived with the location, very far from the centre and in a rather run-down part of town, and with the lack of natural (and otherwise) light in the room. I could have also happily lived with some of the quite odd elements of the room, such as the bizarre lamps/torches covered in masks and other less annoying but equally incomprehensible features: a kettle but no cups and a microwave but no crockery or cutlery. What I absolutely could not live with (well, at least certainly not at night!) was the relentless thumping music coming from the hotel’s own bar for the two nights of my stay. On the first night, it ended shortly after I complained at around two in the morning (plus points for the diligent reception staff. I did try to ring them first but the music was so loud they couldn't hear the phone). The second night I went to sleep with my iPod on and when I woke up, at around three am, all was finally quiet. So why the overall negative review? Because I am under the perhaps deluded impression that a hotel is a place you pay to sleep in. For interesting design features, I would have been more than happy to visit the Musée des Art Décoratifs.

Reviews.Title: “great value, awesome design but could be better in location”
Reviews.Author: FGBLiege
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ Mama Shelter for 3 nights, we've try many hotels in Paris and i have to say that Mama Shelter is our prefered hotel. The design is awesome (lobby, restaurant, rooms), lots of young and trendy guest but it could be pretty noizy around the bar during the evening. The restaurant is OK but the service is too slow. The bad side : the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Joseatoro
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great design and good price to be in Paris in such a hotel, the only two minus: breakfast not included and a little bit far, good choice for a last day stay and visit Pare Lachaise cemetery

Reviews.Title: “it all depends on your tastes”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, but it is definitely not for everyone. I am also prefacing this review on the fact that I paid Euro 79 per night and I'd probably drop my review to 3* if I paid more than Euro 100-120. And at it's normal price of more than Euro 150 I would not stay here. So my review is very price-dependent. As other reviewers have mentioned, this hotel is off the beaten path. It is not hard to get to, just not centrally located. The metro stops are all 10-15 minutes walk to the hotel, but there are a number of bus lines that run almost to the hotel's front door. And since it is almost at the north side of Blvd Peripherique, the taxi to CDG is less than Euro 40. I thought the room features that many people complained about were very cool and funky, from the masks on the light torches to the graffiti-art designed carpeting in the hallways. The hotel design is super cool and very modern. The bed was most comfortable and the bedding, linens, towels and toiletries were of the highest quality. I did not eat here so I cannot comment on the quality, but as other reviewers have expressed it is very expensive and I'd go elsewhere. In addition, the area around the hotel seemed perfectly fine, but a little rough around the edges. Nothing to worry about, just not for everyone's taste. I stayed on an upper floor and was not at all bothered by noise. The windows seemed like they were double glazed and the air conditioning and heating worked fine. I would recommend this for younger travelers and business people who were less interested in location than design. I liked it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Security Issues”
Reviews.Author: Antoinette3
Reviews.Content: I am a single woman who checked into Mama Shelter after paying in full for 2 nights at the lowest available rate (108 euros per night) and the morning after my check-in, a man let himself into my room using the key to my room. He apologized and said he'd been given the key by the reception desk. I promptly called the front desk and they acted surprised and proceeded to call me back three times asking for my name and when I had checked in, because apparently my reservation had been marked as a "no show" in their system. They said they were sorry but did no more than that. This is a stylish hotel in a marginal neighborhood but the front desk is clearly inexperienced, young, unprofessional and made no effort to reassure me or make up for this security breach. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice !”
Reviews.Author: akomp
Reviews.Content: Very trendy hotel, perfect for a young couple or young persons. It is not so well located in Paris but you can take a bus right in front of the hotel, or a metro booth is about 10 mins away on foot. Metro is easy to travel through Paris, so it's not really a problem. There is a little grocery store 5 mins away on foot, very convenient. I was there with my girlfriend and we liked the very trendy decoration. The room is quite big for Paris, and atmosphere of it is very special. The whole hotel is so different to what you can know, it makes it very enjoyable. If you book online in advance you can get a very good price, we got the room for 109euros and I consider it was a good deal (if you book even earlier you can have this same room for 79euros). I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends who want to experience something new.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nlsbstn
Reviews.Content: Hip and trendy! The rooms are not that large, but good enough. The look is excellent. Free internet access and a great bathroom. The nearest metro station is a 10 min walk, but the bus which stops in front of the hotel, brings you also very fast to the centre of town (e.g. Pont Neuf). The hotel restaurant is also hip, trendy and excellent!

Reviews.Title: “COME TO MAMA - YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED!”
Reviews.Author: eagerbeaverhk
Reviews.Content: As hip as it is funky, Mama Shelter is a new breed of hotel, similar to base2stay.com in London - both specialize in providing ultra modern comfort, at a price point that really made me feel I was getting a very good deal. I discovered it totally by chance, after picking up the Paris edition of Time Out, and reading that it was Philippe Starck's latest design project. Although I new no-one who'd stayed there - I believe it's only been open since September 08 - for 119 euros a night, I figured it was worth taking the risk. Am I glad I did! By and large, very professional service, a wonderful restaurant, which is certainly not overpriced, given the quality of food - I enjoyed lunch, even if the service was a little on the slow side - but it IS Paris after all, where lunches are supposed to be savoured!). Dinner was a real treat - extremely attentive service, and I sensed a willingness to please from ALL the staff I encountered, from the restaurant to the room - they even lent me their MacBook charger for the duration, as I'd left mine behind! I like to use the underground/Metro if I'm in a big city, and I had several stations within a 5-10 min radius to choose from. But be careful on the Metro - hide your valuables. I watched the hand of a stranger leave my jacket pocket, without my wallet, fortunately. Alternatively, you can take the bus, right outside the hotel. I liked the whole vibe in Paris, including the barmy weather! I'll be going back to Mama, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: WoosterLad
Reviews.Content: When my travel editor friend told me about Mama Shelter, I checked out the Web site and was pleasantly surprised to find 89 Euro per night deals (for two people) for a weekend visit in late-May. I have to admit that I was skeptical about the rate and was sure the real thing wouldn't match up to the pictures and the hype when I got there. I was pleasantly surprised when I was proven wrong. The location in the 20 e was indeed towards the edge of the city but I was prepared for it. From the moment we got to the hotel, our experience was nothing but pleasant. The staff was friendly and efficient, the decor fun and whimsical and the mood of the place light and jovial. Our room was tiny but for those prices, I didn't expect more. Soon after we got to our room though, we realized that the air conditioning and keyboard to the complimentary mac TV system didn't work. Not only did the hotel technician offer us a regular size key board, the front desk immediately moved us to a larger room, as no other rooms in our category were available. To add to it, the next day, the receptionist informed me that they would be offering us a 50 percent discount off the first night's rate for our inconvenience. The room was large enough, the bathroom was modern and clean and the beds were some of the most comfortable ones I've slept on. The theme throughout the rest of our stay was similar. The only exception was while having an early-evening drink at the outdoor terrace adjacent to the main restaurant, when service was very slow. We sat at the bar and had drinks and food there. By 10pm, the whole place was hopping and realizing that we had choice spots, we didn't vacate our seats until after 2am. We kept on ordering tasty libations from our friendly and talented bartender Joe. The restaurant and bar certainly hosted some of the hottest people in Paris that night. Check out on Sunday was just as seamless as check in on Friday. Mama Shelter is a sure winner for travelers looking for a relatively-cheap hotel in Paris without compromising on western comforts and amenities they may be used to in the United States.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel but spoilt by thieves and bad management”
Reviews.Author: Elvisisdog
Reviews.Content: The Mama Shelter looks the part, although the surrounding streets do look a little run down, venture too far from the hotel and you can feel very uncomfortable very quickly if you choose the wrong direction. Anyway back to the hotel. It's new, with fresh styling and very helpful desk staff. The rooms are a little cramped (but they tell you this on the website) and the bar and restaurant look fantastic. As other reviews have said, the price of drinks and food in the hotel are high (higher than central Paris restaurants) but the food and service are excellent. The down-side, unfortunately while we were out the maid decided to help herself/himself to the contents of my wallet, you wouldn't expect to need to use a safe in a hotel where you need a room key to operate the lifts and have to use 2 lifts to get to the 7 floor. This was very disappointing. The desk staff were very helpful but the management just didn't care, after proving only myself and the maid had been in the room the managing director stated that no further action would be taken. The police weren't interested and gave me a crime report to register in the UK. Unfortunately this wasn't the only occurrence; other friends in the hotel had come back to their room to find their door open (fortunately only small amounts of cash missing). Why did I leave my wallet in the room - I was running the Paris marathon, it wasn't really practical to run with it. Lesson learned - just a shame that a hotel with the aspirations of the mama shelter has stooped this low. On a side note - there is a bouncer on the door in the evening - this may give you a hint to the type of area you are in. The bar/club across the road is very popular, but expect there to be a moderate amount of noise in the evening of the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Juggling plates and dropping a few”
Reviews.Author: snwo
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets good marks on several points, such as cleanliness and decor, but as is the case with many other things, its not quite the full deal; not everything is given the same attention that is deserves. If the same level of thought was put into the service and welcome as the design and the detail then it would certainly get higher marks. My advice to (potential) guests, this is a good hotel at a good price but dont expect to be in the center. My advice to the hotel, you are indeed cool trendy and sooo design, so stop worrying about that and start thinking about how to be nice with it too because trends come and go but good service is always remembered.

Reviews.Title: “Curioser and Curioser”
Reviews.Author: Blackcherry
Reviews.Content: Mama Shelter is a prime example of fashion over function. Funky design? Check. Overpriced food? Check. Bemusing service (even for Paris)? Check. What has been spent on design hasn't been spent on funtionality. Whats the use of providing an electrical socket in the shower-room if you drill the sink leg over the socket, rendering it useless? Would you want to plug your shaver into the only other socket in the bathroom, which is underneath a radiator and facing a window? I don't. Why does this hotel also not provide soap in the toilet? Or mugs to actually drink from - given they provide a kettle? or cutlery to eat with, given they provide a microwave? Why are there on mirrors in Room 629 when our friends had threee huge mirrors in there room?? Why did the cleaners insist on leaving our Television on each day? Why do the hotel employ such rude waiting staff? We need the bill to pay your salary dear! On the plus side, you do get a very comfortable bed at a reasonable price. But I think I'd rather pay a little more money and get more "hotel" for my Euro.

Reviews.Title: “I love it !”
Reviews.Author: Corronchita

Reviews.Title: “MODERN AND REASONABLE PRICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Jean701
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel at Easter Holiday. It's a newly - style hotel. For my age, I like it. That's because the hotel offers me free Wi-Fi, especially iMAC.. and the Phillip Stacrk design facilties. I live on the 7-th floor, so I could enjoy the view more open, not just the building nextby. The room and bathroom is great. However, the light is not enough. It should be improved at this point. Also, I've adjusted the air -conditioning several times, but still could not feel cool in the room. We feel a little bit hot that both of us wake up at mid-night. The running water in the kitchen is clean but taste strange. At first, I want to boil water for drinks, but at last I would rather buy a bottled water. The metro station is far away from hotel, about 10 - 15 minutes walk. Luckily, there is a bus stop in front of hotel. It takes 40 minutes to go Central Paris and Gare De Nord if by bus.

Reviews.Title: “An experience worth trying”
Reviews.Author: LordRichard
Reviews.Content: This was a three day stay brought by our son as a gift. The 20th arrondissment is not the most convenient location for the City centre (€17 taxi from Gare du Nord) and the surrounding area is run down, but improving. Then we discovered the 76 bus, which for €1.60 takes you from the door right to the Bastille or Louvre - one bus driver spoke perfect English! There is also a 26 bus from around the corner which will take you to several of the mainline stations. The hotel itself, which is a converted multi storey car park, is an experience and grows on you after a while. It is certainly different from any other hotel in which we have stayed. You must be prepared for dark rooms and funky decor including writing on the ceilings and carpets, masks on the bedside lights and plasma screens in the loos and used as dining tables. I agree with previous reports that the minimalist approach to lighting in the rooms can be difficult, if you want to read or find something. As regards the food, the breakfast is expensive, but so is everything else in Paris. We have no complaints about the service or the quality of food, which was in fact better than some continental breakfasts we have eaten. We tried the dinner on two evenings (which included a completely off the wall DJ on Saturday night). The restaurant and bars get very busy, so eat early if you don't want a crowded space. Again, the food was not sparkling, but quite sound and efficiently served, although service was a bit slow on Saturday, although hardly surprising given the number of diners. A previous report mentioned noise. We had a room on the 4th floor overlooking the main road (no noise issue). The real problem came from the rock bar opposite, where music was thumping out until 4.00 am. After two nights of this we complained - the result was a free breakfast and an immediate change of room to the back. They took our complaint seriously and dealt with it promptly - now I call that excellent service. In summary then, excellent staff, food average for the price but an interesting place to stay.
